loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un carismático hombre de 30 años, vive con sus padres; Alejo de 64 y Lucila de 65 años. Ellos viven en una acogedora casa ubicada en la sierra peruana.
Desde hace 4 años el amor que siente por las tierras que lo vieron nacer lo impulsaron a dedicarse a la agricultura, y gracias, a la siembra papa, arveja y flores de gladiolo ha podido terminar de estudiar una carrera profesional y cubrir los gastos de sus padres.
La ventaja es que ha podido conocer a comerciantes mayoristas que le pagan lo justo por sus productos, también refiere que de la agricultura le gusta todo excepto que como está sólo debe gastar en la contratación de operarios. Por eso dentro de sus planes futuros quiere unir su vida a alguien que desee trabajar sembrando en mayor cantidad. Asimismo, como estudió farmacéutica desea tener una farmacia, para ayudar a sus vecinos, ya que le gusta ser solidario.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas. Además está feliz de trabajar con las personas de su banco comunal a quienes aprecia porque prácticamente creció con ellos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja para aprovechar la temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a charismatic 30-year-old man. He lives with his parents: Alejo, age 64, and Lucila, age 65. They live in a cozy home in the Peruvian mountain range. The love that he feels for the land of his birth compelled him into agriculture 4 years ago, and thanks to the sowing of potatoes, peas, and gladiolas, he has been able to finish his professional studies and meet his parents' expenses. One advantage of his work is being able to meet wholesalers who pay him fairly for his products. He also likes everything about agriculture except for having to pay for contracted workers. Because of this, his future plans include joining with someone who wants to work at large-scale planting. Additionally, as he studied pharmacology he wants to have a pharmacy in order to help his neighbors since he enjoys being supportive. This is his second loan through MFP, and he is positive that he will make his repayments on time. Also, he appreciates and is happy working with the people in his community bank because he has practically grown up with them. With the money that he is now requesting, he plans to buy a bag of pea seeds so he can take advantage of the planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Angela Del Rosario

texts.es: Ángela Del Rosario tiene 61 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella ofrece una variedad de productos, como la venta de leña que es muy solicitada, golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, verduras, medicinas y detergentes. Es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora por lo que vive muy feliz con su negocio a pesar de ganar mucho con este negocio le proporciona lo necesario para mantenerse a ella y la familia. Ella solicita urgentemente para comprar la materia prima necesaria para mantener a sus clientes. Su deseo es mantener siempre su record crediticio porque sin él no podría avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Rosario is 61 years old and has a small general store in her home. She has had this business for three years. Angela sells a variety of products like firewood, which is very popular, sweets, homemade fruit drinks, basic grains, vegetables, medicines, and detergents. She is a very happy person and a hard worker. She is happy with her business because she earns a lot – enough to take care of her and her family. She is urgently asking for a loan to buy prime materials needed to keep her clients. She would like to keep her credit record clean because without it, she won’t be able to get ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam R. is from the village of Villa Verde Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 25 years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Meriam owns and operates a retail sector operating a retail business selling premium rice in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,160 PHP a month.

Meriam joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group C, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Violet, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of her group in Kihihi. At the top right is B. James who came late for the group photo but is also a member of the same group.

Violet is 37 years old and married with four children, all in secondary school. She also takes care of two dependents. She is a business lady who has been involved in the sale of produce from Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for three years. Her business is characterized by challenges like the poor seasons and price changes.

Violet ensures that her prices are fair to her customers so as not to scare them away and she hopes to expand her business further for increased profits as well as to have a happier family. She needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeurng M., 29, has a small business whose main operation is to buy and sell mature rice in the village. Also, M. buys rice in bulk at reasonable prices from farmers, sends the rice through a milling machine and then sells it for a profit.  By doing this, she has the ability to generate $6 to $7 a day to help improve the financial problems of her family. M. has a life partner in her husband who owns a machine to provide a milling service. The family has three school-aged kids who depend on their income. The price of rice is low at this time. M. hopes to acquire more rice for her stock by using a Kiva loan. She will mill the rice and sell it to earn extra income.

loans.use: To buy more rice.

loans.name: Lener Alexander

texts.es:
El Joven Lener Alexander R. S. trabaja por cuenta propia con un triciclo con el cual transporta clientes por las calles de Chinandega, el tiene ya tres años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y ha sido excelente cliente.
Solicito crédito para realizar reparaciones de su medio de trabajo como llantas y reparaciones de rayos, para mantener su fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Laner Alexander R. S. is self-employed; he provides public transportation services with his three-wheel vehicle along Chinandega’s streets. He has been an excellent CEPRODEL client for three years now. He requested funds to buy tires and repair wheel spokes on his vehicle in order to keep his source of income operating properly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Xoljuyup Group

texts.es: El crédito solicitado serán utilizado para ampliación de capital de la actividad a las que se			 dedican cada uno de las integrantes del grupo ya que cada uno de ellas se han dedicado a la fabricaciòn de blusas para dama y las venden en otros pueblos cercanos y con los ingresos que obtiene sirven para mantaner a sus familias e hijos  viendo la gran necesidad de acudir a la ASOCIACION ASDIR para pedir el apoyo a su apliaciòn de capital para mejorar las ventas  y obtener mas ganancias y tener otro nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The loan requested by this group of women will be used to increase the supply of capital that each of the members requires in order to carry out their work. Since each member of the group earns their money by making women's blouses and selling them in nearby towns, the loan will support this work. The members use the income they receive from their sales to support their families and children. Recognizing their own need for a helping hand, the group decided to ask the ASOCIACION ASDIR to assist them in expanding their capital supply. This in turn will enable them to increase their sales, earn more money, and achieve a better standard of living for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aplicaciòn de capital

loans.name: Judit

texts.es: Judit, D. 38 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. ResiD. en una comunidad  ubicada en L. hermosa selva cuzqueña, donD. tienen su casa propia.DesD. hace 20 años se dedica a L. actividad agrícoL., específicamente al cultivo D. cacao y café. Judit  piensa que será un gran mayorista, siente que todavía le falta mucho por  emprender , y recuerda lo  mucho que le ha costado ser un buen comerciante,pero todo lo logrado se lo debe a sus padres. No contento por el éxito actual D. su negocio , junto con su esposa, decidieron instalar una tienda D. abarrotes, con L. finalidad D. tener una ventaja competitiva ante los demás, y  le está yendo muy bien. Por lo general Judit se hace cargo solo  D. L. siembra D. sus productos agrícolas, pero también cuenta con L. ayuda D.  sus peones que le facilitan el trabajo.Además su esposa está cargo del negocio D. abarrotes D. manera íntegra. Generalmente  venD. sus productos en su comunidad. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su tienda D. abarrotes, implantando nuevos productos naturales , D. acuerdo a L. posibilidades económicas D. sus clientes.Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones, además agradece L. confianza que le esta brindando su grupo comunal.El dinero lo invertirá en comprar más cantidad D.  mercadería con el propósito D. abastecer su tienda D. abarrotes y a L.  vez generar una buena cantidad D. ingresos.
texts.en:
Judit is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a community located in the beautiful Cuzqueña forest, where he has his own house. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years, growing cocoa and coffee. Judit thinks of being a big wholesaler, but feels that he doesn't have everything that he needs to get started, and he remembers what it has cost him to be a good businessman. But he owes all that he has achieved to his parents. Not content with the current success of his business, Judit, along with his wife, decided to open a grocery store with the goal of having a competitive advantage over the rest, and this is going well. Judit usually takes sole care of sowing his crops, but can also count on laborers to help him with his work. His wife works as a partner in the grocery store. They generally sell their products in their community. For the future, Judit plans to expand his grocery store and introduce new natural products, in accordance with the economic means of his customers. This is his fourth loan from MFP, and he promises to meet his obligations. He is also grateful for the confidence that is offered to his community group. He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of merchandise with the goal of stocking his grocery store and bringing in a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Brunilda del Carmen C. M., es un adulto mayor de 63 años habitante de Pilas Orientales, se dedican a la agricultura, tienen 10 hijos casados e independientes, tiene un ato y pretenden a futuro mejorar el corral, ha sido casi una vida de dedicarse a este rubro que ha alimentado  a sus hijos todos estos años.

Ellos se dedican a la siembra de plátanos y planean diversificar sus siembras pero para esto solicitan un  préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes y pesticidas e insumos vegetativos que salvaguarden el buen crecimiento de los nuevos cultivos, tras esto las buenas utilidades generadas por un aumento en la producción, les permitirá mejores condiciones de vida que favorezcan todos sus hijos puesto que desean heredarles sus terrenos. Ha sido gracias a los fondos de Kiva y Afodenic que han progresado sus condiciones de vida por el apoyo a nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brunilda del Carmen C. M., is a 63-year old lady from Pilas Orientales. She works in farming, and has 10 married and independent children. She keeps animals and in the future plans to improve the corral. She has spent almost her whole life working in this area and the farming has fed her sons and daughters all these years. She grows plantains and plans on diversifying her crops. However with this loan that she is requesting now, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides, and plant food that will safeguard the healthy growth of her new seedlings. The good earnings generated by the increase in production will allow her to improve the living conditions that will help all her children, since they want to inherit the land. She has gotten ahead thanks to the funds from Kiva and Afodenic which have enabled her to support new sources of income.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en:
María Teresa G. T., a 23-year-old pepper producer and mother of three, lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. María is a dedicated mother and producer. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvest of Tabasco peppers. María works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. María´s husband works at a local orange-producing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement the family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and to buy food. The rural zone where María and her family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water. The family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. María is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land and labor.
 
Although this is an individual loan, the community in which María and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All laborial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by María with the help of her family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. María will need roughly one year before her peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest.
 
Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or, PROPICA is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and caring for younger siblings. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting, working the land as needed. 

The main factor that has stood in the way of increasing her production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to María, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital, and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, María wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ali Sangaré est une homme marié de 36 et père d’un enfant. Il réside avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Dialanicoro de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, il commença  tôt les activités génératrices de revenus, notamment l’achat et la vente de céréales qu’il  a appris auprès d’un de ses ami. Il mène cette activité dans les différents marchés de Bougouni. 
Avec une expérience de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier, pour acheter de  une grande quantité de céréales.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir davantage  son entreprise.
texts.en:
M. Ali Sangaré is 36, married, and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and child in the Dialanicoro neighborhood of Bougouni (the third administrative region of Mali). After dropping out of school, he started in business to earn money (buying and selling cereals, which a friend taught him how to do). He does it in various marketplaces in Bougouni. After five years, he is an expert at what he does and is highly sought after. Looking to grow his business, he joined Soro Yiriwaso. He is asking for his first loan, to buy a large amount of cereals which he will get in Bougouni and neighboring villages. With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested to grow his business even more.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cereals

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en:
Henrik H. is 58 years old; he lives in Tsovaghugh village, Sevan area. Henrik is married and has a son who is a student. 

Henrik has a higher education: his specialty is mechanical engineering. Now he works at Gegharkunik marz Regional Administration as an expert. At the same time Henrik engages in farming; in his farm he has: cows and calves, pigs, chickens and 16 beehives. Henrik’s wife helps him in farming and thus they support their family and pay for their son’s education. 

Henrik seeks a 1,000,000 AMD loan which he will spend on repairing his beehives and buying wax paper.

loans.use: repairing beehives and buying wax paper

loans.name: Joyce Wangari

texts.en:
Joyce has operated her cafe in Naivasha town since the year 2002.  She is 23 years old, married to Samuel M., and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to use the cash to expand her cafe and add more seating space to cater to her ever-growing clientele.

In the future Joyce hopes to expand and have her own mid-size hotel.

loans.use: To expand her cafe.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Hasina R..  She is married but has no children.  In 2007, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to increase the inventory of her store.  In the future, Hasina plans to capitalize more.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates or join our lending team.

loans.use: increase store inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret was born in 1960. And she is not married, but is blessed with five children. She shares two rooms with her five children at Musang, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Margaret has had great difficulties in life ranging from ill-health, the untimely death of relatives, failure to attain a quality education and inadequate capital. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to carry on with her projects. With this loan, she plans to buy food items such as rice, beans & corn, which she will sell and make more profit. She thinks her business is an influential one and she has succeeded over the past years. She, as well, regularly undertakes contracts. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford good food items at affordable prices.

She will invest some of her profits into her business and use the rest to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and to upgrade her standard of living. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase rice, corn, salt and beans.

loans.name: Evelien

texts.en:
Eveline is a 29-year-old married man. He has one adopted child who is in school. Evelien has a video library where he rents and sells digital video discs (DVDs), video compact discs (VCDs) and compact discs (CDs). Evelien also has a sound system for rent which is comprised of speakers and amplifiers. He has been in this business for one year.

Evelien is requesting a loan to buy more CDs, VCDs and DVDs. He is hoping to have a great studio in the future in which he will produce films and songs for local artists in order to make more money.

loans.use: To buy more CDs, VCDs and DVDs

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, su esposo es comerciante y vive en Lima, pero cuando puede los visita y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Guísela es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, en formato DVD, ella siente que la ciudad de Tarma es un buen mercado, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y que es un negocio muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a su restaurante, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que permanecer en su tienda todo el día, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, espera implementar mejor su tienda de DVDs. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Guísela, 32, is a very cheerful, unassuming woman.  She lives in her own house with her two beloved children.  Her husband is a merchant and lives in Lima but when he can he visits.  What she most desires is to improve their quality of life.

Guísela’s business is the sale of movies, music videos, documentaries and cartoons in DVD format.  She feels that the city of Tarma is a good market because she knows that there is great demand for DVDs and it is a very profitable business.

What she enjoys the most about her work is that she can determine her own work schedule.  She considers the most difficult thing to be having to spend all day tending the shop.  However, she knows that this is her job and she must do it.  In time, she’d like to stock her store with more DVDs.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She expects to be very punctual with repayments because she wants to be able to have access to more loans.  She is very participative in her communal bank.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more DVDs to offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: To stock up with more movies to increase sales.

loans.name: Lucya

texts.en: Lucya M. is currently in the business of selling simsim, onions and phase and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and bags of simsim to sell. Lucya is 50 years old and is married with a husband that is a deminer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more onions and bags of simsim to sell

loans.name: Maria Ebonne

texts.en:
Maria Ebonne C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Maria Ebonne is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Maria Ebonne owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. Her husband is the driver for local community members. Maria Ebonne has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Ebonne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Ebonne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Maria Ebonne is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maria Ebonne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of motorcycle.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya.She has two children, aged 20 and 11, and both are attending school. She has been doing mixed farming for eight years, producing milk, wheat and maize, and selling locally.

She has applied for this loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She believes the income generated will cater to the children's education. She hopes to supply milk supply on a large scale, though animal diseases remain her challenge. She had acquired a loan of 30,000 KES previously and paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María Pérez es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su cultura y tradiciones, siendo su gente calida y amable.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de fantasías como son aretes, lasos, diademas, etc., actividad que desempeña hace 20 años, trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de domingo a domingo, trabaja en la calle ya que el municipio aun no les entrega puestos para que puedan trabajar más cómodamente.

Doña María tiene 42 años, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo también es casado pero aun vive en su casa compartiendo gastos y sus dos últimas hijas están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como comerciante ambulante,  vende artefactos eléctricos como son planchas, licuadoras y también sus repuestos. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Este es el  cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y se siente muy contenta ya que cuenta con grandes amigas con quienes conversa y sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo.  El dinero de su crédito es para incrementar más mercadería para la temporada navideña. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María Pérez is a member of the El Ahorro ("The Savings") communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a city which is reknowned for the architectural beauty of its historic centre, its culture and traditions, and for the warmth of its people.

Señora María dedicates her time to the sale of costume jewellery, such as earrings, bows, hairbands, etc. - an activity she began some 20 years ago. She works from 9am to 6pm, 7 days a week. She sells her wares in the street, because the town council refuse to put up stalls where she could work more comfortably. 

Señora María is 42 years old, and is married with 4 children, aged 20, 18, 16 and 14. Her eldest son is married and living independently; her second son is also married but still lives in her house and shares the costs. Her two younger daughters are studying at a secondary school in the city. Her husband works as a travelling salesman, selling electrical goods such as irons, blenders, and spare parts.They do not have their own home, but live in rented accommodation. 

This is her 4th loan with the communal bank, and she is very happy, because she has made great friends among its members, with whom she can chat and leave behind her dailiy routine. The money from her loan is to increase her stock for the Christmas season. Her goal is to expand her business much more.

loans.use:
Comprar aretes, vinchas, lazos, diademas, etc.
To buy earrings, bows, hairclips, hairbands, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane S. is married and has 10 children between the ages of 1 and 22.  Her husband works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They live in 109, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. Mary Jane earns her living by buying and selling charcoal and rice.  Mary Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of  9,000  PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 7,200 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living.  For her fifth loan, she is borrowing 12,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy stocks of charcoal, rice, and rice bran for the pigs so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Mary Jane is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kitembe Tukwatanize Group

texts.en: Lawrence is a thirty-six-year-old widower with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda with an aspiration of educating his children up to higher levels of education. He trades in alcohol and has been in business for two years, still reaping tangible benefits amidst challenges of long distance and lack of transport facilities. Lawrence needs the loan to buy alcohol for sale.

loans.use: Buying alcohol for sale

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem K. is a 46-year-old married woman who earns an income by cultivating rice crops.  She has been farming since 1979.   Her husband works as a motor taxi driver in and around Kompong Cham province. 

This family normally earns an average of $6 per day to cover their family’s daily living needs. They have six children, all of whom are single. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. 

In order to earn extra profit, Soem K. is requesting a loan to rent her neighbor’s land in order to plant more rice crop, buy two sacks of fertilizer, and pay plowing cost.

loans.use: To rent land to plant more rice, buy fertilizer, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda C. M.
2011-04
300,000
Amanda C. M. tiene 47 años, viven en l aAurora de Heredia y se dedica junto a su social Mireidy Guzman a la distribución de helados en diferentes lugares del Valle Central, para esto requieren el apoyo de un carro estilo Pick up, en el cual transportan los helados para distribuirlos a sus clientes.
En este momento el vehículo a presentado dificultades que les han incrementado los costos de producción al tener que alquilar un vehículo, ya que no pueden descuidar a sus clientes.
El objetivo de este crédito es para la reparación de este y así poder seguir con su negocio de venta y distribución de helados. La señora Amanda C.  acaba de cancelar un crédito de Kiva para la mejora en un apartamento de alquiler, este se pago de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amanda C. M.
2011-04
300,000

Amanda C. M., 47, lives in La Aurora de Heredia and together with her partner, Mireidy Guzmán, delivers ice-cream in various locations in the Central Valley.  To do this they rely upon a pick-up truck that they use to transport the ice-cream to deliver among their customers.

At the present, the vehicle is having a few problems that increase their production costs because they’ve had to lease a vehicle to continue to take care of their customers.

The objective of this loan is to repair their truck in order to continue selling and distributing ice-cream.  

Amanda C. has just repaid a Kiva loan that was used to make improvements on a rental unit; she repaid this loan on time.

loans.use: To repair her ice-cream delivery truck.

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of nine members located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. Mrs. Hou S. P. was born in 1969 and is the group leader, selected by the other members. 

Her husband, Mr. Mann P., works as an electrician for a company, which enables him to earn a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children. Three are students and also support their mother's business; the youngest one is 5 years old and not in school yet. 

Mrs. Hou S. P. sells groceries in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to support her purpose.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: El Sr L.  labora como conductor  es casado, tiene dos persona a su cargo,  es el primer  crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece  el apoyo que le brindan esta institución con  este  desembolso, para poder mejorar su vivienda, comprar materiales de construcción como  cemento madera cinz, cemento, mano de obra, para hacer una cocina para darle mejor condicion y ampliar la sala, esta institucion esta mejorando el nivel de vida de muchas persona nicaraguense y se le agradece porque si esta ayuda no podria realizar su sueño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. L. works as a driver. He is married and has two people under his care. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he is very grateful for the support that they have given him with this loan, which he will use for home improvement. He will purchase construction materials like cement, wood, and corrugated metal roofing. He will also pay workers to build a kitchen and both remodel and expand the living room. This microfinance institute is improving the quality of life for many Nicaraguans, and it is appreciated because without this help, Mr. L. would not realize his dream of owning a house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 46 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy responsable. Ella inicio este medio de vida por su Mama ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a este negocio, Maria se ha caracterizado por ser una muy buena cliente ya que el pago de sus cuotas las realiza en tiempo y forma se encuentra muy contenta con este financiamiento que lo utilizara para la compra de telas, pantalones, camisas, shorts, faldas, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, pintura de uñas y maquillaje.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 46 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. She is known for being a very responsible person. Maria started earning a living in this manner by working with her mother, who previously engaged in this type of business. She has proven that she is a good client since she submits her loan payments in a timely manner.

Maria is pleased to receive this loan because she will use the funds to buy fabrics, trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics, treatments, nail polish, and make-up.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, shoes, cosmetics, treatments, nail polish, and make-up.

loans.name: Khumidin

texts.en:
Khumidin lives in Kurgantube, Tajikistan. He is married and lives with his parents. He started his business 4 years ago. His career began with his father and the business investment he received from his father. His father works as a butcher.

Khumidin buys cattle from Kurgantyube, Yavan, Jomi and Khuroson markets. Khumidin believes that that the profit from the resale of the cattle is greater than from the fattening of cattle, as well as providing a constant turnover. Khumidin would like to get a loan of 4,000 Somoni to purchase cattle, to expand his business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer lives in a small city in Pakistan called Chichawatni, which is famous for its agricultural industry. She is 46 years old and a mother of a 15-year-old son who operates a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits on a four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city and financially contributing to the family. Anwer lives in a three-room brick house with her family. She came here after her marriage to B. A.. Her husband is also involved in the fruit-selling business.  He also sells fruit on a four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city. Anwer herself stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for his business to increase his sales and profits. Anwer is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business conditions with the loan.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Anwer.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana desde muy jòven se iniciò en el comercio vendiendo mercancias con su madre cuando esta la traia, desde Maicao, un municipio fronterizo perteneciente al departamento de la Guajira, y las vendia en Soledad y en Barranquilla, en el departamento del Atlàntico. Como Diana es una mujer que no se queda quieta y muy proyectada, poco a poco fue  construyendo su propio capital de trabajo y ahora con el apoyo de su esposo, distribuye  ranchos, viveres, cosmèticos, ropa informal y confecciones para damas, que ella misma fabrica; sus principales clientes son los  tenderos y muchas  familias ubicadas en diferentes barrios del sur occidente  y el sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con esta actividad obtiene sus principales ingresos y acompañados de los que genera su esposo, son capaces de sostener su hogar y en especial a sus hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad, con los que sueñan ver convertidos en personas exitosas y esta es justamente su principal motivaciòn.
Su credikiva es el primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con el comprarà viveres, ranchos, cosmèticos y ropa, porque tiene encargados y debe responder a sus clientes oportunamente. Su gran sueño es tener un local, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, pero eso es mas adelante y mientras esto ocurre sus inventarios rotan cada 13 dias y su rentabilidad es no menor de un 32%.
texts.en:
When she was very young, Diana began selling merchandise with her mother who brought it from Maicao, a border town belonging to the department of Guajira.  She sold her goods in Soledad and Barranquilla in the department of Atlántico.  Since Diana is a very active woman who wants to get ahead, she began to put together her own working capital little by little.   With the help of her husband she now distributes canned goods, groceries, cosmetics, informal clothing and ladies' dresses that she sews herself.  Her main customers are store-owners and families in the different neighborhoods of the southwest and south of the city of Barranquilla.

Through her business she is the main source of income and, together with her husband's income, they are able to take care of household expenses and care for their children, ages 2 and 7, who they want to see grow up and be successfull.  This is their main purpose.

The CrediKiva loan is Diana's first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  It will be used to buy groceries, canned goods, cosmetics and clothing, because customers have already placed their orders and these must be filled.  Her dream is to have her own shop where she can display her products.  That will be sometime in the future, but for now she has an inventory turnover of 14 days and profitability of no less than 32%.

loans.use: To buy groceries, canned goods, cosmetics and clothing, which are on order

loans.name: Milkah Muthoni

texts.en: Milkah, who has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years, was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Milkah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and prepare land.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, married to John, and they have four school-going children. Margaret has practised farming in Olkalou for the last few years.  

Margaret was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to plant potatoes during this rainy season, so she's planning to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor. In the future, Margaret hopes to buy more land and practice large scale farming in Olkalou.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  Lucy is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business and to repair of her food stall.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy cooking ingredients and repair her food stall

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is a married man from the town of Sto. Nino South Cotabato.  He has three children.  His eldest child is 11 while his youngest is 9.  He is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 8 years now.

His average income from his business is PHP 12,000 per month.  He utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs.  Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Arnel hopes to manage a bigger farm and be able to send all of his children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. Ma. Fe is married and has a sari-sari store in the Philippines.

Ma. Fe requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items like coffee and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 3 years.

In future, Ma. Fe would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, noodles and snack food to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Orazkhan's Group

texts.en: According to statistics, women in Central Asia are two times less likely to open businesses than men. There are a number of reasons, like fear of risk and lack of knowledge about managing a business. However, Orazkhan is not among those people. Orazkhan, 42, is the leader of this group. She knows that a good business should be profitable, both for her and society. Four years ago, while breeding and reselling cattle which brought only intermittent income, she decided to start another type of profitable business – a chicken farm. With an initial startup capital of 6,000 soms, Orazkhan purchased 60 productive chickens. After two months of keeping the poultry in warm and sanitized conditions, the hens reached a state of giving at least two eggs a day each. Besides distributing eggs to her neighbors at market price, Orazkhan usually has more left for her family’s consumption. The business helps her provide her family with nutritious food like chicken and diversify the menu. Throughout these four years, Orazkhan has been making 6,000 - 7,000 soms income per month, which is quite enough to help her husband and their daughter. The loan requested by Orazkhan will be invested into development of the business and buying more chickens. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Benkola F Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA F sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt,  WARABA SEYDOU, qui la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour  et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. WARABA SEYDOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkola F group are married women who average 33 years of age and have an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of organising their activities better at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow rice and groundnut among other things. They are on their first loan from the institution.

With this first loan, Waraba Seydou, who is sitting on the far right, is planning to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment as well as paying for labor and hoeing costs in order to maintain around half a hectar of rice and groundnut.

Once the crops have been harvested, the produce is sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou, to a customer base made up of men and women. Waraba Seydou is expecting to make an average profit of around 35,000FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, weedkiller, hoeing and small materials

loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre "El Atardecer"los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle asi ya que se tardaron mucho en pensar que nombre ponerle y empezó a atardecer entonces así decidieron ponerle.
La señora Maria de los Angeles ,cuenta con 36 años de edad, esta casada actualmente con el señor Alberto, su matrimonio ha durado 20 años, en dicho matrimonio, nacieron 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son mujeres y solo un niño, todos viven en la misma vivienda.

La señora Maria de los Angeles tiene un negocio de recicladora de material PET en dicho negocio, lleva un mes ya que antes de este se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, dejo el negocio porque no obtenia ganacias suficientes, ella espera que con el nuevo negocio que emprendio tenga mejor exito; la señora Maria de los Angeles solicito el credito para invertir en su negocio, ya que los desafios que presenta es la falta de material PET, como botellas de bebidas, plasticos, carton, periodico y papel, ella aseguara que con el credito que se otorgo no tendra mas problemas para la compara de material, lo que ella busca es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para qu sigan estudiando y ayudar a su comunidad para que la contaminacion reduzca.

Los integrantes restantes del grupo el credito lo ocuparan para comprar otras cosas ejemplo: Adela L. lo invertira de ropa como pantalones, blusas,camisas y chamarras, Maria Remdios lo utilizara para la compra de borregos para hacer crecer el numero de su ganado, en cuanto a la señora Maria Ines T. solicito el credito para invertir en su tienda de abarrotes comprando aceite, jabon, arroz, frijoles, cafe, shampoo,pasta dental y sal para comsumo humano, Maria del Carmen comprara mas borregos, finalmente Graciela L. comprara pollos la cual empezara con este negocio. 
El grupo en general espera crecer en sus negocios para obtener una mejor caliadad de vida, agradeciendole a Frac y a Kiva por su gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The group's name is "El Atardecer" (the sunset), the members of the group decided to name it this way because it was taking them so long to think of a group name that it started to get late.

Maria de los Angeles is 36 and has been married to Alberto for 20 years, they have five children, four girls and one boy, they all live in the same home.

Maria de los Angeles has a PET recycling business, she's been in this business for a month, prior to it she used to sell clothes, where she didn't make enough profit so she hopes this new business has more success; Maria de los Angeles requested a loan to invest in the business because she faces challenges such as the shortage of PET such as drink bottles, cardboard, newspaper and paper, she indicates that with the loan she won't have any problems to purchase material and she is hoping to support her children so that they keep studying and support the community to reduce pollution.

The other members of the group will purchase things like:  Adela L. will invest it in clothing such as pants, blouses, shirts and jackets; Maria Remedios will buy sheep to increase her inventory, while Maria Ines T. will invest it in her grocery store to buy oil, soap, rice, beans, coffee, shampoo, toothpsate and salt; Maria del Carmen will buy sheep as well and finally Graciela L. will buy chicken to start a new business.

The whole group hopes to expand their respective business to have a better quality of life, thanking Frac and Kiva for their help.

loans.use: to buy PET material such as bottles, cardboard, newspaper and plastic.

loans.name: Nuevas Lideres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS LIDERES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Nemesia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ropa. 

La señora Nemesia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida desde hace doce años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra platos, garrafa, cocina y un puesto de venta, ya que quiere expandir su negocio y vender en otro puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "Nuevas Líderes" ["New Leaders"] communal bank will be starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela Center. The group is comprised of six members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Ms. Nemesia. The members of this communal bank work in a variety of businesses. Among them we have: sweets sales, food sales, cosmetics sales, a neighborhood store and clothing sales.

Ms. Nemesia indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer, which she did through an invitation from one of her friends. She currently has a food sales business that she has run for 12 years.

The loan that she will take out is for purchasing plates, carafes, a stove and a food stall, as she would like to expand her business and sell from another stall. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nemesia responds that she likes the educational sessions and the savings.

loans.use: to buy plates, carafes and a food stand

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La señora Norma,   es una clienta antigua  de la institución, que demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación, la cliente vive en la zona de Villa Esperanza de la cuidad de el alto, La Paz-Bolivia (zona norte), la Sra. Norma vive con sus dos pequeños hijos a quienes dedica su atención y amor de madre. Cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá para el cuidado de ellos cuando tiene que salir a la venta de la comida que prepara con esmero y una buena sazón, el esposo por razones de trabajo se encuentra en el interior en Santa Cruz, quien manda por giro bancario dinero para apoyar así a su familia.  La Sra. Norma es muy trabajadora y además abnegada con sus hijos, ella tiene la voluntad de que con trabajo lograra que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor y pueda costear sus estudios profesionales, por lo que se esfuerza a lograrlo día a día en su afanosa labor, con el dinero del crédito comprara material de construcción para hacer construir su vivienda y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is a longtime client of the institution, where she found the staff friendly and courteous during her assessment.  She lives in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto, near La Paz, in the northern part of Bolivia.

Norma lives with her 2 small children to whom she devotes her care and love as a mother.  Her mother helps her look after them, when she goes out to sell the carefully made and flavorful food that she prepares.  

Due to his work, her husband is in the interior in Santa Cruz department, and he sends money via bank transfer to support his family. 

Norma is very hard-working and self-sacrificing when it comes to her children.  Her wish is that with her work she will succeed in helping her children have a better future and be able to afford their professional studies. This why she works hard to achieve this day by day, and is so industrious. 

She will use the loan to buy construction materials to have a house built, in order to provide greater comfort for her family.

loans.use: To build a house.

loans.name: Laura Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita de la ciudad Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Laura, ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres ya son  mayores de edad y el menor de 13 años  estudia en el colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo de dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una ama de casa que para ayudar  a su esposo realiza los créditos, él  se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da,  trabaja todos los días, hay días que junto a otras personas se van a alta mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia  por la mañana, allí nuestra amiga espera que desembarquen para realizar los trabajos de limpieza de los peces para luego  entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta la playa   para llevar los pescados a los mercados de otras ciudades. Ellos llevan más 20 años en esta actividad y les ha ido bien ya que gracias a Dios siempre tienen buena pesca.

Este crédito es para comprar alimento, combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Lleva  9 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con estos créditos ha logrado  salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Banco Comunal Crucita" meet in the Crucita Parrish of the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this pretty area and that are visited by Ecuadoran tourists and foreigners alike.  It is known by the name “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

This is the place where we meet Señora Laura.  She is 46 years old, married and with her husband had four children.  Three of their children are grown.  The youngest is 13 years old and goes to school.  Three of her children still live with her.  Her husband makes his living as a fisherman.

Señora Laura is a homemaker who takes care of the loans to help her husband.  He makes his living fishing and selling the fruits of the sea.  He works every day.  Some days, he and the other fisherman don't go out to sea until late in the day and then don't come back until the following morning.  There our friend waits for him to disembark to begin her work cleaning the fish.  They then sell the fish to the tradesmen who come to the beach.  They bring their purchased fish to markets in other cities.  Señora Laura and her husband have been in this business for over 20 years.  It has gone well for them since, thank goodness, they always are successful in the fishing.

This loan is for the purchase of food, gas, nets and other fishing necessities.  Señora Laura has been in the communal bank for 9 years, and she likes it because the loans have helped her to get ahead.
 
Her dream is to continue getting ahead and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase food, gas, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Marisel De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marisel De los Ángeles de 46 años  se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos,  la cual inició hace 5 años con ingresos propios. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda en donde tiene  a sus cerdos, ella tiene que salir a algunas comarcas lejanas para comprar cerdos a buenos precios a pesar de que es un trabajo cansado es algo que le gusta hacer. Su crédito  es con el fin de comprar cerdos, ya que tiene ciertas ofertas y quiere aprovecharlas. Marisel quiere seguir creciendo, aprovechando la demanda del mercado para obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Marisel De los Ángeles is 46 years old.  She buys and sells pigs.  She started five years ago with her own money.  Her business is located at her own house, where she has her pigs.

She needs to go to some far-away regions to buy the pigs at a good price.  In spite of the fact that it is tiring work, it is something that she likes to do.

Her loan is to buy pigs.  There are special offers that she wants to take advantage of.  Marisel wants to keep growing and taking advantage of the demand in the market in order to get good earnings.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar, 47, is a watchman who lives with his 3 sons and his wife in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife Ulambayar works as a janitress in a public organization. He has been working as a watchman for many years, but still could not earn enough money. Because his monthly income is low, he cannot provide their necessities.  

Therefore, he decided to start his own new business, which will be a taxi service in addition to his current job. He will run his new business on his days off.  If he can start his new business as planned, he will save all the earnings for the future education of his sons. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to covering his new car payment, purchased to start his own taxi business for increasing his earnings.

loans.use: To cover his new car payment for starting his own taxi business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old and married to Winnie. Together they have two children aged five and two years. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000 from his business.

This is his third loan term with KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to support his farming business.

He will buy moire dairy cows with the anticipate profit. His dream is to own a dairy farm and have a stable income to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Divinas” es un comité de 9 mujeres muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias las unas con las otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad Villarrica, donde todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen semanalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda para poder desarrollar su situación económica.
La señora Felisa se dedica a la cocina, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que ella cocina muy buenos platillos. Tiene una clientela bien formada, quienes siempre van hasta su local a probar lo que prepara.  Por medio de  este trabajo ella pudo sobresalir y cumplir con sus obligaciones. Ya que le va muy bien, quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de la fundación, para la compra de carne, huevos, verduras, y otros ingredientes que puede llegar a necesitar para elaborar sus alimentos.
Estas señoras estan muy contentas de seguir participando en este programa de microcrédito, pues han mejorado así bastante sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas” group is a committee of nine women who are very well organized, bonded, hardworking and supportive of each other. These women are from the city of Villarrica where they are all neighbors and friends. They meet weekly to offer each other support and help so as to develop their financial circumstances. 

Ms. Felisa devotes herself to cooking, which is going very well for her, since she prepares very good dishes. She has a well-established clientele who always come to her shop to try whatever she prepares. By means of this work she was able to excel and meet her obligations. Since it is going so well for her she wants to keep growing, and that is why she is asking the foundation for help, in order to buy meat, eggs, vegetables and other ingredients she may need for making her foods. 

These women are very happy to keep participating in this microloan program since they have improved their businesses considerably by it.

loans.use: to purchase meat, eggs, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ushindi Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi SHG Group in Western Kenya! Adijah is the facilitator of the Ushindi SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Adijah  takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Adijah had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 5 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Adijah was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Adijah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Adijah will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ushindi SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Adijah and her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Norbobo

texts.ru: Норбобо житель города Вахдат. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он пекарь, печет лепешки для продажи. Вместе с ним работают двое людей, которые помогают ему. Он берет кредит для покупки муки и угля.
texts.en: Norbobo lives in Vahdat. He is 51 years old, married, and has two children. He is a baker. He bakes and sells flat breads. He has two people working for him. He is taking out a loan to buy flour and coal.

loans.use: to buy flour and coal.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and single. 

To make a living, Ivy owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ivy has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Ivy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy  is requesting a loan of  20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Duhaguruke Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 21. Two of them attend school. 

Beatrice is a group leader for the group called "Duhaguruke," which simply means "Let's Stand" in English. The group members do different business activities and all of them are happy with the loan given to them. 

As the group leader, Beatrice has sold foodstuffs in a restaurant for the past six years. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the profit she will save money. In the future, Beatrice would like to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Tamara Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo conforman cuatro mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es Josefa tiene la edad de 32 años, casada, con un hijo de 9 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y de cosméticos de Avon, tiene de ser cliente de la institución 4 años. El crédito lo solicita para diversificar su actividad economica  en   la compra de ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, blusas, shores, trajecitos de niños, etc. María Alejandra tiene 42 años su negocio es la venta de productos ferreteros y librería, Julia Marcelina tiene 65 años su negocio es la venta de comida  y Johana tiene 38 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four determined entrepreneurial women. One of them is Josefa who is 32 years old and is married with a 9-year-old son. She has a business selling used clothing and Avon cosmetics. She has been a client of the institution for 4 years.

Josefa is asking for the loan to diversify her income generating activity by buying new clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, children's clothing etc.

María Alejandra is 42 years old and has a business selling hardware and stationery; Julia Marcelina is 65 and has a business selling food and Johana who is 38 has a business selling used clothing.

loans.use: to buy new clothing such as trousers, shirts, blouses, shorts, children's clothing etc.

loans.name: Sayoramo

texts.ru: Сайёрамо 38 летняя прекрасная мать и хорошая жена. Она мать двоих детей. Детям 8 и 7 лет. Сайёрамо закончила мед колледж. Она с детства мечтала стать медсестрой и помогать людям. Сайёрамо 6 лет работает медсестрой в больнице. Она хорошо справляется с соей работой, и она хорошо ухаживает пациентам. Саёерамо планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Уже наступила зима, и Сайерамо хочет по скорее начать и  завершить ремонт. Она с такими планами просит кредит.

loans.use: Для купли стройматериалы и ремонт дома.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old. This mother of 2 children is the only breadwinner of her family. She started up  her business 7 years ago with selling a small variety of kitchen equipment. With this small business and only $300 in working capital, she could hardly meet her family\\\'s everyday needs even in food.

In 2004 when Roza got involved in market trading, her business considerably expanded.

Now she needs $400 to expand her business, open food section and buy digital scales. She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: Roza plans to open food section and expand her business

loans.name: Nyamizi

texts.en:
Nyamizi is married with four children. She lives at Mtakuja in the Ilala district of Dar es Salaam. She sells right beside her residence. She has been in this business for over six years.

Luckily enough she lives near the industrial area. Her major customers are industrial workers. She has more customers than she can serve, particularly during lunch time. She has few chairs and tables, food serving dishes, food wrapping materials and a stock of food. She need to improve this situation before competitors seize her opportunity. She is in need of USD750

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy A. is a 39-year old entrepreneur.  She lives in Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and seven children.  She specializes in making the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough).  She has been in this business for the last 8 years and her business income has increase from the initial $3 to $6 a day. The location of her business, within the community for many years, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well with the advantage of loan funds, which enabled her to increase her stock and materials. With hard work and perseverance, Dorothy has created a successful income-generating business.  She is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses and school fees for her children.  Dorothy has requested a $600 loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Improve the stock of food items in her bakery kiosk, where she makes local breads and sweets.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a seasoned entrepreneur from Kherson, Ukraine. Married and the mother of one grown daughter, she started her business about 10 years ago at a time when she needed to find a job right away and business ownership was her best opportunity. She currently sells a range of sports apparel at the large Central Market in Kherson. Elena has a reputation for treating customers with care and kind-heartedness, qualities that set her apart from many other businesses which often lack good customer service. Elena has also proven to be a great client with Nadiya Ukraine, having successfully repaid 11 loans. She has requested a loan of $1,000 so that she can purchase new inventory and continue developing her business.

loans.use: Increase inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama J. is forty-nine years old and married with six children. She has been in business for the last ten years but her business was small before her previous loans. She is engaged in selling roasted peanuts. She also buys large quantities of palm oil and exports it to traders from the Republic of Guinea.

With her previous loans Mariama expanded her business and profit. She said she purchased three sheep 18 months ago with her first loan and her flock has increased to ten sheep which she keeps in the village with her relatives. She is requesting $200 to purchase forty gallons of palm oil and four bags of peanuts to increase her stock. Her hope is to help her husband to pay school fees for the children and to develop her sheep farm little by little.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of palm oil and peanuts for distribution

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suarmi

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suarmi is used to working hard. She raises and fatten pig in her yards to support her family's income. From her farm income, she managed to afford high school tuition for her 3 children that now can support themselves independently. She pays so much attention on her 2 pigs that she is growing, so that the 2 piglets she purchsed for $50 can now be sold for $100, the net profit of about $35 can be used to afford the ever increasing living expenses. Ni Ketut is also thinking of her old age, when she will not be as productive as she is now. Ni Ketut plans to improve her farming techniques and expand her farm by adding more pigs. She also needs more money to pay for feeds that are becoming more expensive. She hopes to achieve all these using the loan from DINARI, which may help her optimally expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunter
