Ni Ketut Suarmi terbiasa dengan kehidupan yang selalu diisi dengan kerja keras. Walaupun sebagai wanita biasa, tetapi Ni Ketut Suarmi tidak mau tinggal diam saja melihat suami bekerja keras untuk menghidupi keluarga. Ni Ketut Suarmi ikut ambil bagian dalam mengusahakan kesejahteraan keluarganya dengan memelihara babi penggemukan di sekitar pekarangan rumahnya. Karena keuletannya, Ni Ketut Suarmi mampu menyekolahkan 3 orang anaknya sampai mereka tamat pendidikan menengah dan akhirnya bisa bekerja untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya masing-masing. 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang dipeliharanya diperhatikannya dengan sangat baik sehingga dari dua ekor bibit yang dibelinya dengan harga Rp 450.000 dalam waktu 2,5 bulan mampu dijual dengan seharga Rp 900.000 dan keuntungan bersih yang diperolehnya sekitar Rp 300.000 dan itu dipakai untuk menutupi biaya hidup yang semakin tinggi. Ni Ketut Suarmi juga memikirkan hari tuanya yang tentu saja tidak bisa seproduktif seperti sekarang, sehingga Ni Ketut Suarmi pun berusaha keras untuk mengelola usahanya dengan baik yaitu dengan berencana menambah jumlah ternak yang dipelihara serta menyediakan stok pakan yang memadai karena harga pakan sudah semakin mahal. Dengan menjalin kerjasama dengan DINARI lewat pinjaman modal usaha, Ni Ketut Suarmi melihat peluang untuk mengembangkan usahanya untuk mendapat hasil yang maksimal.

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Chiri

texts.en: Mrs Chiri M., 33 yrs old, is a  woman residing in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is a village situated within the Lalitpur district. Most of the people around here are involved in agriculture. Mrs Chiri M. has 4 members in her family including herself. Her husband is Prakash M.. He is a civil servant. She has two sons. The elder son is 13 yrs old, studying in grade 6, whereas the younger son is 7 yrs old, studying in grade 2. Mrs M. is doing goat farming. She sells goats on a contract basis and earns money for her family. She needs loan to buy more kid goats and necessary food for these.

loans.use: To buy more kid goats

loans.name: Kawalad(I) Group

texts.en: Joyce is married with two children. Her current business is selling new clothes and cloth fabrics. She mainly deals with a type of fabric called Bitengi. She intends to use the extra profits to buy a fresian calf.

loans.use: To add investments and purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Mutekanga B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Cate N.. She is currently in the business of new clothing and is requesting a loan to start a retail shop. Cate is 46 years old and is married to a husband who is an accountant . She has 2 children, 1.5 and 4 years old. They do not attend school. Each week, Cate makes approximately UGX 30000 in profit. With the extra profit she will earn with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Cate has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 250,000, in order to increase her stock. The loan was paid back on time.

Cate is joined in her small group by Lukia N. and Aisha H.. Lukia N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to boost her business. Aisha H. is currently operating a drug shop and wants a loan to purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.use: to start up a retail shop business

loans.name: Nafosat

texts.en:
Nafosat is 24 years old and is married with one child. Nafosat works the land together with her husband and his parents. This united family works hard; during the growing season, they work in the fields from the early morning until late at night. Nafosat grows crops such as potatoes and carrots. The family business is stable and generates their main income.

Nafosat plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. For this purpose she requests US $850.00 for 9 months. Part of the loan will be spent for the salaries of hired seasonal workers. Nafosat has already demonstrated herself to be an accurate client. She promises to repay the new loan on time and thanks all for their support.

loans.use: To support farming during the next growing season.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty A. sells groceries in Ilogbo Community, not too far from Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 32 years of age, married, and has 2 children. She acquired the skill of trading many years ago and has been in business since 2004. Beauty needs a loan of $600 to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
I have a construction in progress at my dwelling; I have the necessary material to place windows, plaster and paint, but I request a support of $1,000 to be able to place the concrete slab which is necessary to finish the building of this room.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una construcción sin terminar en mi vivienda, cuento con el material necesario para colocar las ventanas, enjarrar y pintar, pero solicito su apoyo con” $ 1,000.00 dlls, para poder colocar la losa de concreto, ya que es lo único que me es necesario en este cuarto que estoy construyendo, para su terminación.

loans.use: Place concrete slab to finish building a room.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes T. sells charcoal and local dishes such as gari, kenkey, and maize. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to cover their family's living expenses.

Fortunately, demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business in order to increase her profits. As such, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her products by expanding her business.

loans.name: Fuaselela

texts.en:
Fuaselela F., 45, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells her goods to her friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during harvest season she supplies the public market 4 days per week with her produce.

Fuaselela has had 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Fuaselela’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps operating the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, bushknifes, claves, and wire for s fence.

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es:
Gerbacio is bricklayer and works in the city of El Alto; obtaining small contracts for construction and spare parts of small, typical houses is his specialty. This source of income allows him to support his 5 children, who are 12, 10, 8, 6 and 4 years of age. Gerbacio has been widowed for some time. He and his family have been living in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.

The loan proceeds will be invested in construction materials. Gerbacio also needs to finish his own home, but with loan proceeds the well-being of his children will improve.

This is the second time Gerbacio is receiving the aid of Kiva. His conscientious re-payments allow him to be considered for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Gerbacio es albañil y trabaja en la ciudad de El Alto consiguiendo pequeños contratos (construcción y refacción de pequeñas viviendas familiares) en su especialidad. Dicha fuente de ingreso sirve para cubrir la manutención de sus 5 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6 y 4 años de edad. Gervasio enviudó hace bastante tiempo, él y su familia viven en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será invertido en material de construcción, a eso añadimos que le falta concluir su vivienda pero con cada crédito el bienestar de sus hijos mejorará.

Es la segunda vez que recibe ayuda de Kiva, su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a un nuevo préstamo.

loans.use:
Purchase of Spare Parts for Home Construction
REFACCIÓN DE VIVIENDA

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther, socia del Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se inició vendiendo carteras de suelas, broches, marroquí, y ropa interior, para ello salía con todos sus hijos a vender.

Ahora confecciona y vende al por mayor ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. La mercadería lo distribuye en diversas ciudades del departamento a los negociantes minoristas, también alquila cuartos. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará telas de diferentes colores, hilos, agujas, elásticos en fardo, para la elaboración de su mercadería, y así sus clientes tengan mayor opción para escoger.

Esther tiene 57 años, es una mujer optimista y trabajadora y muy hábil para el negocio que aprovechó sus ganancias para aumentar el negocio y la red de distribución. Tiene como meta el mejorar y aumentar su casa para tener un local propio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther, a member of the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora', lives in the department and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She started selling leather wallets, broaches and underwear and because of that she goes out with all her children to sell.

She now makes and sells women's, men's and children's underwear. She distributes this merchandise in the different cities in the department to small businessmen. She also rents out rooms.

With the loan of $2000 which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy different colored materials, threads, needles, bundles of elastic to make her merchandise so that her clients will have more to choose from.

Esther is 57 years old and is an optimistic, hard working woman who is very skilled at her job and took advantage of her earnings to enlarge her business and distribution network. Her aim is to improve and enlarge her house to have her own store for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material, thread, needles and elastic/Compra de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos.

loans.name: Tooa

texts.en: Tooa T., 49, is married and has three children. She has five years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the school children five days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about $250 USD).  SPBD loans are Tooa's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be use to buy chicken, sausages, soy sauce, tomato sauce, paper plates, onions, garlic onions, mutton flaps, and a big frying pan for her canteen business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her canteen

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam K. sells charcoal and firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day and earns a profit of approximately $15 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and charcoal to sell for a profit.  

Maryam is 22 years old, divorced, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy  more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rompiendo Barreras Group

texts.en: Sandra F. is a single women who has two children whom she takes care of all by herself. Unfortunately, where she is from it is very common for the dads to leave their families. So now she is alone to try and take care of her young children. The hardest part is that she does not have a steady income and has to do all sorts of things to provide food for her kids. She recently came to Esperanza International (Kiva's Field Partner) to seek a loan so she could start her own small business and start earning an income. She plans on selling small food products in her area, such as rice, salt, bread, and other small items. She is confident in herself that she can grow her business and hopes to someday have her own grocery story. She said she wants nothing more than to provide a good life for her kids because she loves them more than anything else. She is a great mother and knows this is her opportunity to change her life, and also the lives of her children. She and the other 14 people in this group are all excited about this opportunity, and ready to take this first step!!

loans.use: Buying food products

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en:
Tuty P. lives in Khujabd. She is married with five children. She started her business twelve years ago but she traded in small wares firstly. In 2005 she heard about the MicroInvest loan procedure and applied. Tuty has now been a client of our microfinance program for three years. She is an executive and reliable client who has not had any delays in her loan repayment. She is now successfully taking the next step with an increased loan sum.

Tuty is engaged in a commercial service trading perfumery and children's wear. She has a good assortment that she brings from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. Tuty is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 800 STJ for three months to import new seasonal wears.

loans.use: To import a new seasonal assortment of wears.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret I. sells clothes and foodstuffs. She is also a tailor who makes lovely clothes for her customers. She is very hardworking.

Margaret is requesting a loan of 140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en:
Adisa S. is 41-year-old trader, married with six children--five are in the community school and the last-born is in school. She lives in her husband's family house with the children at Koforidua, which is a farming community in the Ashanti region. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals, like maize, and bananas. She started this business three years ago from Offinso but realized that business was slow. She then relocated to the next town, Abofour, and has remained in this business since then. Through this, Adisa has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and bananas to serve her customers throughout the season. Especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country, she believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains and bunches of bananas from the farmers, avoiding middlemen who sell to her at a high price.

Adisa belongs to a village bank called ‘Nhyira’, which means Blessing. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of maize and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
L. is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are attending school. She is married to Vy, 27, who works as a fence pole provider. L. is a local vegetable planter on a plot of land behind her house, inherited from her parents, which she always harvest eight times a year. In that way, she can earn a better profit for supporting her family.

As the family is growing up, L. recently faces a difficulty with transportation. Hence, L. is applying for a loan of US$ 250 to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family gain a better standard of living. (L. was not available to be photographed, but her husband was.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es: Deyci tiene 34 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, por el momento vive en casa de su madrina de matrimonio. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de lana procesada que trae directamente de Lima y vende a 12 soles el kilo. Asimismo, compra tapices y en cada viaje a la capital los ofrece a sus clientes. Su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos las veces que viaja; es por ello que se siente muy complacida y feliz por ser una mujer dinámica y hábil para el comercio. Su meta es ahorrar dinero para comprar su propia casa donde pueda realizar su trabajo, ya que actualmente lo hace en un local que alquiló su madrina. Deyci en una nueva cliente de MFP, ha decidido integrar un banco comunal porque una de las socias la invitó y le contó sobre el método de trabajo que les permite progresar en su negocio. El dinero que solicita en este su primer préstamo es para incrementar su mercadería, para que no le falte ningún color de lana a su establecimiento.
texts.en:
Deyci is 34 years old, she is married and has three children. At the moment she lives at her godmother's house. It has been 5 years since she started making a living by selling processed wool. She brings the processed wool directly from Lima and she sells it at 12 Soles per Kilo. She also buys tapistries and every time she travels to the capital she offers them to her clients. Her business generates a good source of income for her when she travels to and from the capital. She is really happy being a dynamic woman that is capable of running a business. Her goal is to save up some money and buy her own home where she can continue her work. Right now she rents a space for her business from her godmother. Deyci is one of MFP's clients. She decided to be part of a communal bank because one of her friends invited her and told Deyci about the methods they teach that help people to improve their businesses. The money that she will get from this first loan will help her increase her merchandise, so that she will have all of the colors of wool that she needs for her establishment.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Merchandise

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.en:
Shuhratjon A. first applied to MicroInvest in 2004. He described himself as a serious and reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure and hopes for long-term co-operation. Thanks to the previous loans he was able to improve significantly the livestock business terms.

Shuhratjon has been engaged in the livestock business for 5 years and he has the appropriate skills to increase the existing flock. Shuhratjon also works as a security guard in a factory but the love of raising animals brings him to the livestock business. Shuhratjon is applying to Kiva for a business support loan of 4000 Tajikistan Somonis for 5 months to be used for the purchase of a pedigreed bull.

loans.use: Purchase of a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is married, has three children and is a graduate of the local junior high school.  For the last 10 years, she has worked as a trader, selling maize at a heavily-trafficked area known as Shama Junction. She uses her income to help pay for her family’s expenses, mostly school fees. She has applied for a loan to buy maize to sell to her customers, and will use the increased income made possible by this loan to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Efren

texts.es: Efren S. vive junto a su familia en la comunidad de villa carmen caluyo provincia aroma, desde hace 43 años atrás. Efrén se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa al por mayor en las diferentes ferias de la localidad, realiza esta actividad junto a su esposa desde hace 22 años atrás. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado, el cliente tiene un buen trato a sus clientes y responsabilidad y su puesto de venta se encuentra en la plena plaza principal. Además que los 22 años de experiencia apoyan bastante al desarrollo de sus actividades. Efrén destina el crédito  para la compra de  ganado vacuno. Efrén no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en otros buros de información.
texts.en:
Efrén lives with his family in the community of Villa Carmen Caluyo in the province of Aroma; he has lived here for the past 43 years. Efrén is dedicated to purchasing and selling potatoes, chuño and tunta (a freeze-dried potato product dating back to times before the Incan empire), in bulk at the various markets in his region. He has been doing this activity with his wife for the past 22 years. Indeed competition exists in the market. He treats his clients well and with responsibility, and his sales stand is located entirely in the main plaza. Plus his 22 years of experience really supports his business. Efrén plans to use his loan to buy a cow. Efrén does not have any bad history with the credit bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow.

loans.name: 21-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Năng T. Thị (141) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The official name of this borrowing group is 21-Nam Ngạn (17-03-21). Năng is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2007, Năng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Năng is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will again be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 3rd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị Mùi (18) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. N. Thị Hạnh (142) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. N. Thị Loan (144) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her bakery business. 4. N. Thị Ngọc (145) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 5. N. Thị Thuý (27) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 6. P. Thị Thảo (147) is a 65-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Năng T. Thị (141) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Năng là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 21-Nam Ngạn (17-03-21). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Năng thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Năng kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, Năng đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Năng đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Mùi (18) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Hạnh (142) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Loan (144) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì. 4. N. Thị Ngọc (145) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 5. N. Thị Thuý (27) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 6. P. Thị Thảo (147) là 65 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Masala Group

texts.en:
Here are Mohamed T., Fatmata M., Jane C., Ibrahim S., and Zainab C.. They are small-scale business people in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group Masala. This will be their fourth loan from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, these business people were able to expand their businesses and increase their profit margins, consequently improving their standard of living. They were able to provide their children with three meals a day, send them to school, and meet most of their daily financial challenges. 

Mohamed T. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed is 38 years of age. He was born in Makeni where he currently resides together with his wife who is also a businesswoman. The two have five children, two of whom are in secondary school, two in primary school, and the last is still very young. Mohamed sells baking soda, garlic, onions, and vegetable oil. He has been a businessman for over ten years. With this loan, he will travel to neighboring Guinea, where the goods he sells are relatively cheaper to buy.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Serhed

texts.en: "Hi, dear my friends. As you know, I got success in my business with your help. I will never forget about it! Thank you very much!" Serhed is applying to Kiva for a second loan. The first time he applied for the loan amount of $800 and he repaid this loan successfully. Now he needs a loan of 1300 AZN to buy the things necessary for improving his business. You can see in the picture he has not changed his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Felipe Arturo

texts.es: Felipe Arturo M. B. reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Felipe tiene  36 años de edad  vive con su familia en casa propia; Felipe posee un negocio donde se dedica de forma ambulante a comercializar verduras y huevos en diferentes colonias y pueblos de Sonsonate, Felipe maneja su desgastado carro cargado con todos sus productos donde muchos de sus clientes ya saben la hora y el día que llegara,  para esperarlo y abastecerse de la buena calidad que ofrece la mercadería de Felipe. El destino del crédito que solicita Felipe es para surtir de variedad de sus productos como frutas y mayor cantidad de huevos de gallina.
texts.en:
Felipe Arturo M. B. lives in Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. He is 36 years old and lives with his family in their own house. Felipe is a hawking merchant who sells vegetables and eggs in several residential neighborhoods and villages of Sonsonate. He loads all his products into his worn car and drives to his customers. Many of them know the day and time when he travels to their area and wait for him to come and supply them with his high quality products. Felipe applies for a loan to stock up his inventory, in particular by various fruits and a larger quantity of hen’s eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Poeu

texts.en:
S., at the age of 32, has much experience growing vegetables and selling fish and vegetables. She is taking a loan to buy fertilizer for her field and materials for her husband's fishing business.

Her life partner, Hoeurn, 36, is famous, for he is good at fishing. He hands his catch from the river to his wife to sell in the morning and late afternoon at the market. The couple also take time to care for their vegetables growing behind their house. When the vegetables are harvested, S. will take them to the market to sell them at for a good price.

S. wants all her children to finish university.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field and materials for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsan O., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Theng, age 22, live a long National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2006 and have a one year old son. 

Kimsan has been a driver for over ten years. He drives for a brick link in his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their son. He hopes to build his own house to live because currently he and his wife rent a house to stay. So, Kimsan is applying for a loan of $700 in order to purchase wooden materials to make the building.

loans.use: To purchase wooden materials to build his own house for living.

loans.name: Jackbed

texts.en:
Jackbed is a 23-year-old married lady who operates her embroidery business in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past 7 months. She is requesting her first loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stocks of fabric. She hopes to own rental houses one day, enlarge her business, and employ people. She describes herself as focused, visionary, and serious in business.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stocks of fabrics

loans.name: Assucena Avelina

texts.pt:
Assucena M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo capital de Moçambique tem 23 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 2 filhos de 4 e 1 anos de idades. Frequenta 12ª classe na Escola Secundaria Joaquim Chissano. Para alem de seus filhos vive também com a sogra e o cunhado numa casa alugada. O seu marido é funcionário do Ministério da Educação ajuda também na partilha de responsabilidade de casa.

Em 2002 sai rumo a Boane a procura de vaga escolar, onde em 2006 casa oficialmente e iniciando assim a sua careira profissional de facturação numa empresa denominada Moçambique farmas. Faz 9 horas diárias auferindo 3.300.00mt por mes. Conheceu a Hluvuku através  das mobilizações feitas e este é o seu terceiro crédito no valor de 15.000.00mt para compra de material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 13.000.00mt e 4.300.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios é ver a sua casa concluída, o que não é fácil devido ao alto custo de material construção, mas já com estes empréstimos paulatinamente vai atingindo o seu objectivo e vendo um dos seus maiores sonhos realizados.
Propõe se a reembolsar o valor o mais rápido possível para pedir outros empréstimos para a aquisição de mais materiais ate a conclusão.
texts.en:
Assucena M. was born in Maputo, Mozambique's capital, and she is 23 years old. She is married and has two children, a 4 and a 1 year old. She is finishing 12th grade at the Secondary School Joaquim Chissano. She lives with her husband and children, plus her mother-in-law and a brother-in-law in a rented house. Her husband works at the Secretary of Education and shares with her the household expenses. Assucena was married in 2006 and works processing invoices at a company called Mozambique Farmas. She works 9 hours a day and makes 3.300,00MT (U$ 115) per month. She's asking for U$550 to buy construction supplies. It's her third loan for the same purpose and she had no issues with paying back the other two. Assucena dreams of seeing her house finished so she can move there with her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction supplies

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Mrs. Flordeliza R. owns a business processing vinegar and selling home care products such as fabric conditioner and home care cleaners. Mrs. R. is married to Marcelo R. a specialist supervisor at the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR). They are blessed with four children and three have already graduated with degrees. The youngest is presently studying in Commerce courses. 

Mrs. R. dreams of upgrading her products to earn a higher income and support her son’s education. To this end, she wants to borrow the amount of Php 5,000 for additional business capital. She would like to one day have her own place of business. She believes that she will achieve her dreams through managing and expanding her business.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en: Nisa D. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and is married. Nisa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling daily-used products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nisa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 40-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Abed has been selling fish and aquariums since 2001. Abed requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase fish food for his work. This is his second cycle, and he has always paid on time. Abed is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues. Abed decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase fish food for his work

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the city of Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 32 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair  equipment used in the business. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair equipment used in the business

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se inicio mediante la iniciativa de la señora Angélica E. quien organizo toda para conformar la cooperativa ya que tenia muchas conocidas quienes querían trabajar  y de esa forma pudieron llegar junto  a la Fundación Paraguaya  y pudieron encontrar  ayuda  crediticia y técnica asistida método con se trabaja  dentro del proyecto  contacto Mujeres Emprendedoras.  
Cada integrante realiza una actividad diferente de acuerdo a las facilidades con que cuenta.
Así se comenta el caso de la señora Pastora P. quien se  dedica a la venta de comestible, ella tiene un pequeño copetín en la vereda de su casa en una casilla donde vende sus preparados como empanada , panchos, milanesas y gaseosa. Ella trabaja desde  muy temprano para lograr buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su marido quien es albañil  y no posee un sueldo fijo para poder mantener a sus 5 hijos.
 Así la Sra, Pastora como muchas otras señoras lucha todos los días para lograr el bienestar de su familias.

La sra. Maria Leticia E. se dedica a la decoración, invirtió el dinero  el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo                                              de manera pueda ofrecer buena mas calidad en su trabajo a sus clientes.

La sra. Yolanda O. se dedica a la artesanía en cueros, invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( cuero, termos, pegamentos, accesorios) logrando ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías a sus clientes. 

La sra. Maria Liz M. se dedica a la venta de lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de Lencería en  general de manera que pueda ofrecer buena variedad y calidad de lencerías a sus clientes.

La sra. Angelina E. posee un despensa, invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general ( azucar, harina, yerba, lacteos, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de mercaderías en general a sus clientes.

La sra. Mirtha Liliana A. se dedica a la costura, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo (telas, hilos, accesorios, etc) logrando de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas  a su clientela.

La sra. Maria P. dedica es modista, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo (tela, hilo, accesorios) logrando de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de prendas a sus clientes. 

La sra. Cecilia B. se dedica a la venta de frutas invirtió el dinero en la compra de semillas y elementos para el cultivo de sus frutas.

La sra. Vicenta A. se dedica a la venta de Frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de frutas en general, logrando obtener mayor variedad de frutas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Eusebia C. de R. se dedica a la venta de frutas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas en general, logrando de ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Zunilda Elizabeth R. se dedica a la venta de  verduras y frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de verduras y frutas en general (al por mayor).

La sra. Fabiana C. se dedica a venta de ropas en general, invirtio el dinero en la compra de ropas, para  ofrecer buena variedad de prendas de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Marcelina R. de Vera se dedica a la venta de ropa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de prendas de vestir en general,           obteniendo de ese modo variedad y calidad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Sonia Rosalina G. se dedica a la venta de artículos de mercería, invirtió el dinero en la compra buena variedad de mercaderías para  sus clientes.

La sra. Francisca Pabla O. se dedica a la frutas, invirtio el dinero en la compra de frutas en general logrando de ese modo ofrece buena variedad de frutas a su clientela.
  
La sra. Mirtas G. de Ferreira se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, invirtio el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboracion de los productos de limpieza, logrando asi  ofrecer buena variedad de productos de limpieza a sus clientes.

La sra. Elvia Antonia E. se decica a la decoracion de cumpleaños, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( accesorios, tela, cintas, etc.)logrando asi ofrecer calida en su servicio a su clientela.

La sra. Victoriana E. Q. es artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, pegamento, cuero) logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad y calidad en su trabajo a sus clientes.

La sra. Alicia Raquel T. es Artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( cuero, termos, pegamentos) logrando asi ofrecer variedad de mercaderias  a sus clientes.

La sra. Lilian E. Q. se dedica a la venta de artículos de  mercería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de artículos en general, logrando así ofrecer variedad de artículos a sus clientes.

La sra. Ramona Q. de E. posee un copetín, invirtió el dinero en la compra de bebidas, panificados, embutidos, etc, logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de minutas y bebidas a sus clientes.

La sra. Sabina P. de R. es artesana, invirtió el dinero en la compra de elementos para su trabajo ( karanday, cuero, etc.) logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de mercaderías a su clientela.

La sra. Elena M. de R. se dedica a la venta de comestibles, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestibles, logrando de ese modo ofrecer variedad de minutas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee was founded on the initiative of Angélica E., who carried out the organizational tasks to form the cooperative, since she knew many people who wanted to work, and in this way they could approach the Fundación Paraguaya together and find help with credit as well as technical assistance, by working with the project Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women). Each member pursues a different line of work, in accordance with her particular skills. For instance, in the case of Pastora P., she sells food, operating a small snack bar in a booth outside her home, where she sells her preparations such as empanadas, hot dogs, cutlets and soft drinks. She starts work very early in the morning so that she can receive a good income and help her husband -- who is a mason and does not have a fixed salary -- provide support for their 5 children. Like many other women, Pastora struggles every day for her family's well-being. Maria Leticia E. works in the area of decoration. She invested the funds in purchasing supplies for her business, so that she can offer higher-quality work to her customers. Yolanda O. makes handicrafts in leather; she invested the money in purchasing materials for her work (leather, insulated bottles, glue, accessories, etc.), so that she can offer an attractive variety of products to her customers. Maria Liz M. sells lingerie; she invested the money in purchasing a range of lingerie so that she can offer an excellent variety of good-quality products to her customers. Angelina E. has a small shop. She invested her funds in purchasing general merchandise (sugar, flour, herbs for traditional tea, dairy products, etc.), so she can offer a good variety of grocery products to her customers. Mirtha Liliana A. is a tailor. She invested the money in buying supplies for her work (fabrics, thread, accessories, etc.), so that she can offer a greater variety of garments to her clientele. Maria P. makes fashion clothing; she invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (fabrics, thread, accessories), so that she can offer a greater variety of outfits to her customers. Cecilia B. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying seeds and supplies for fruit cultivation. Vicenta A. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying fruit in general, in order to offer a greater variety of fruit to her customers. Eusebia C. de R. sells fruit of various kinds; she invested the funds in buying fruit in general, in order to offer a greater variety of fruit to her customers. Zunilda Elizabeth R. sells fruits and vegetables; she invested the funds in buying a variety of fruits and vegetables on a wholesale basis. Fabiana C. sells clothing; she invested the funds in buying clothes, in order to offer a broad variety of garments to her customers. Marcelina R. de Vera sells clothing; she invested the funds in purchasing a variety of garments, to achieve variety and quality in the articles of clothing she offers to her customers. Sonia Rosalina G. sells sewing supplies; she invested the funds in buying a good variety of merchandise to offer to her customers. Francisca Pabla O. sells fruit; she invested the funds in buying fruits in general, in order to offer a good variety of fruit to her clientele. Mirtas G. de Ferreira sells cleaning products. She invested the funds in buying supplies for preparing cleaning products, so that she can offer a good variety of cleaning products to her clients. Elvia Antonia E.'s business is decorating for birthday celebrations. She invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (accessories, fabric, ribbons, etc.), so that she can offer quality service to her clientele. Victoriana E. Q. is an artisan. She invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (straw, glue, leather), so that she can offer variety and quality in her work for her customers. Alicia Raquel T. is an artisan; she invested the funds in buying supplies for her work (leather, insulated bottles, glue), so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her customers. Lilian E. Q. sells sewing supplies; she invested the funds in buying a general range of articles so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her clients. Ramona Q. de E. operates a snack bar; she invested the funds in purchasing drinks, breads, sausages / sandwich meats, etc., so she can offer a variety of convenient foods and beverages to her customers. Sabina P. de R. is an artisan; she invested the funds in purchasing supplies for her work (straw, leather, etc.), so that she can offer a variety of merchandise to her customers. Elena M. de R. sells food; she invested the funds in purchasing ingredients to prepare her products, so that she can offer a variety of convenient foods to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and supplies for the members' diverse businesses

loans.name: Eliseo Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Sr. Eliseo C. A. tiene un taller de mecánica (mantenimiento y reparación de motos y vehículos livianos), ubicado en el C. urbano de Condega, El Sr. Eliseo C. utilizara el crédito para la compra de una computadora, la que le facilitara a su hija mayor para que se dedique a la toma y edición de fotografías, este servicio será brindado al publico y de esta manera obtener un ingreso familiar adicional.
 
El Sr. Eliseo C. A. comenzó desde temprana edad al oficio de mecánica automotriz, este negocio comenzó a crecer ya que es el único taller reconocido en el Municipio teniendo así buena demanda de su servicio. Este cliente ha tenido este negocio desde hace 15 años , trabaja cada día desde las 7 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde por seis días a la semana, antes de dedicarse a la mecánica el era productor de tabaco.

El espera que con la compra de esta computadora su hija se dedique a las tomas fotografías y ediciones de estas y así aumentar los ingresos a la familia y también el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Eliseo C. A. has a mechanic's workshop (motorcycle and light vehicle maintenance and repair) located in the urban zone of Condega. Mr. Eliseo C. will use this loan for the purchase of a computer which will allow his eldest daughter to start a photography business, taking and editing pictures. She will offer these services publicly, allowing the family to attain additional revenues. Mr. Eliseo C. A. started working as an automotive mechanic at a young age. His business has been growing since it is the only official workshop in the municipality, and is therefore in high demand. He has owned this business for 15 years, and he works 6 days a week, each day from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. Before becoming a mechanic, he used to grow tobacco. He hopes that with the purchase of this computer, his daughter will be able to start taking pictures and editing them in order to increase their family's income and also improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and its accessories

loans.name: God Blessing Group

texts.en:
God Blessing is a group of five borrowers, led by Oretha S., that live and work near Red Light in Paynesville, Liberia.  Red Light is the country's largest market, and is about 10 kilometers from the capital Monrovia.  It is a bustling area full of shops, stalls, and vendor tables.

Oretha is 35 years old and is engaged to be married -- "I pray to God it will be soon," Oretha says of her wedding.  She has four children, two girls and two boys, and also takes care of her mother.  All of her children are in school now; the oldest, a boy, is 20 and in the 11th grade, and the youngest, a 12-year-old girl, is in the 5th grade.

Many Liberians had their schooling interrupted by years of civil war and conflict, but now that peace has come they are returning to school to finish their studies.  Oretha herself has only been able to complete the 6th grade, and she has no plans to return to school at this time.

Oretha started her business selling lapa, lace, and linen in 2002.  Lapa is patterned, printed African fabric; Oretha is wearing a dress made of lapa in the photo that accompanies this profile.  She says most of the lapa she buys and resells is imported from Togo. She sells from a table at the Red Light market.  Most of her customers are women, but men also buy the lapa she sells.  She says of her business:  "I take care of it and manage it well."  Oretha plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 37,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more lapa and lace.  

Oretha hopes to be able to grow her business enough so that she can open a proper storefront at the Red Light market.  She also wants to be able to help her children finish their education, "so they can help me in my old age."


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is the one holding the sign.  Kumbah N. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy lapa (printed African cloth), linen, and lace.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comite Kuña Guapa se encuentra en pleno desarrollo dentro del cuarto ciclo trabando con los asesores de la Fundacion con realización de actividades y capacitaciones. 
Cada integrante de realiza una actividad diferente para su ingreso sin perder es espíritu de querer trabajar juntas para lograr sus metas de manera más rápida la de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Se puede comentar e caso de la Candida J. de 43 años de edad , tiene 1 hijo estudiante de nivel secundario. En la semana ella  trabaja fuera de su casa. 
Los  fines de semana prepara comestible y lo vende en frente a su casa .Ella es viuda por lo mismo lleva una vida muy sacrificada  que tiene un ya que se encarga dia del día a día de su familia.   
Tiene una casita pequeña , que desearía ampliar para abrir un copetín y dar vianda, agradece por la ayuda recibida de la  Fundación desea refaccionar su pequeña casita, ella es el sostén de la casa.

texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is in full development of its fourth loan cycle working with the Fundación’s advisers in activities and training sessions. Each member is involved in a different money-making activity without losing their cooperative spirit and desire to work together to meet their goal to improve their families’s quality of life more rapidly. We can highlight Candida’s case. She is 43 years old and has a son, who is in secondary school. During the week she works outside the home. On weekends, she prepares meals that she sells in front of her house. She is a widow so her life is hard because she alone cares for her family. She has a small house which she would like to enlarge in order to open a snack bar and serve meals. She is grateful for the help from the Fundación; she wants to remodel her home. She is her household’s sole provider. Activities of the other members: 1 Rafaela F. de R. Hamburger sales 2 Sonia E. G.. Beauty Salon 3 Maria C. Espìnola G. General Store 4 Norma B. A.. Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for hamburgers.

loans.name: Jose-Ann

texts.en:
Jose-ann D. is from the village of Don Carlos Bukidnon. She is 27 year-old single woman. Jose-ann owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She's been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

Jose-ann joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from HSPFI for 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mugoma Feed The Family Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
R. John is 33 years old and married with six children aged 10, 8, 6, 4, 4 & 2 years. He also takes care of four dependents.

John has operated a retail shop in Mugoma trading centre for seven years. It started as a small shop with poor transport means to the main city where he buys his stock. He is able to make 30,000/= as weekly profits and this helps him in taking care of his family, mostly his children’s school fees.

John has good customer care skills and this has tremendously improved his business expansion and increased his profit margin for self-sustainability. John sells general merchandise and he needs a loan to be able to buy more goods to increase  his stock.

John appears in the small photo and also in the group photo. He is such a hardworking and devoted man.

loans.use: To buy more goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María B. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante para una empresa D. seguridad. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como: granos básicos, bebidas, huevos y otros más, los cuales son muy necesario en los hogares. Es a través D. este negocio como Ana junto a su esposo cuentan con una estabilidad económica, ya que es así como ella le brinda ayuda para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. alimentos, sobre todo aquellos, los cuales se comercializan por mayor, como el pan, las bebidas y golosinas, esto sería D. gran beneficio para Ana ya que le permitiría aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poseer un negocio muy estable, el cual pueda ser competencia D. otras tiendas en el alrededor. Ana es una mujer la cual desea mucho salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad D. vida, y es gracias al préstamo hecho a Integral que ella podrá alcanzar esta meta.
texts.en:
Ana María B. D. M. is 40 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband who works as a guard for a security company. Ana manages a store where she sells basic necessities such as grains, beverages, eggs, and other items that are needed in the home. It is through this business that she is able to achieve financial stability as well as proviD. for all of the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of food items, particularly those sold in bulk such as bread, beverages, and candy. This will be of great benefit to Ana because it will allow her to increase her sales and create a more stable business, which will make it more competitive with other stores in the surrounding area. Ana is a woman who greatly desires to succeed and improve her quality of life. Thanks to the loan provided by Apoyo Integral, she will able to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Elnor

texts.en: Elnor G. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Elnor is engaged in selling books and through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income of 5,000 PHP. In 2009, Elnor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now obtaining her new loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mario De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Mario de la Cruz R. A., vive acompañado de su esposa, la cual le apoya en la venta de los productos químicos que él vende, desde hace más de 10 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad que le apoyan económicamente a sus padres.

Uno de los máximos obstáculos que ha tenido en los últimos años ha sido la muerte de su caballo, el cual le ayudaba a transportar los productos de venta, gracias al ahorro de la familia es que pronto realizara la compra de un nuevo potro, pero una de sus prioridades hoy en dia, es la compra de los materiales de cerámica para la instalación del piso de su hogar y compra de laminas de zinc para entechar el porche de su hogar, espera que le ayuden económicamente y de esta manera mejorar sus niveles de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mario de la Cruz R. A. lives with his wife. She helps him sell chemical products, which he has sold for more than 10 years. They have 3 adult children who support their parents financially. One of the major obstacles that he has had in the last few years has been the death of his horse, who used to help him transport the products he sells. Thanks to the family's savings, soon he will buy a new colt. However, one of his priorities today is the purchase of the ceramics materials for the installation of a floor in his home and in the purchase of sheets of zinc to put a roof over the porch of his house. He hopes that you will help him financially and in this way improve his and his wife's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four people located in Sieng Kong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vanna B. is the group leader of the loan who was selected by the members. The members of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Vanna B. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. For supporting this farm, Mrs. Vanna B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crops. Aside from bieng a farmer she also is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Sophat K., is a government worker. With these jobs they can receive a small salary to support their family's living. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yelba Merari

texts.es: En el barrio reparto David Antonio, vive Yelba Merari 25 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años su Madre inició este negocio fue aquí donde trabajaba e inició vendiendo productos como calzado y ropa, pero debido problemas de salud decide dejárselo a Yelba quien con todo su empeño y mucha disciplina ha podido solventar sus necesidades. En la actualidad está aplicando a su tercer crédito con la Fundación con él comprará calzado, pantalones, camisas, sabanas, toallas, bolsos y cosméticos pues se acerca la festividad del día de la Madre y ya tiene bastante pedidos. Por ahora sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yelba Merari is 25 years old and lives in the neighborhood subdivision called David Antonio. Three years ago, her mother started a business and Yelba began working with her selling products such as shoes and clothing. However, her mother experienced health problems and decided to leave the business to Yelba so that she could do all the work since she has the discipline to meet their needs.

At the moment, Yelba is applying for her third loan with Fundación Leon in order to buy shoes, trousers, shirts, bed sheets, towels, handbags, and cosmetics for Mother’s Day and to fulfill her existing orders. For now, she dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy shoes, trousers, shirts, bed sheets, towels, handbags, and cosmetics

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B., 40, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Wilson B., a landscaping artist, they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own landscaping business for quite some time now.

Rowena has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her landscaping business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 50,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying supplies and other materials for their landscaping needs.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying supplies for a landscaping business

loans.name: Videlmina

texts.es: Videlmina,  de 41 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Cuando Videlmina abrió su pequeña tienda, le costó mucho establecerse en el mercado y ganar clientes, con el pasar del tiempo y con el esfuerzo y voluntad que le puso a su trabajo, logró fortalecerse y poco a poco empezó a recuperarse económicamente, y con las ganancias que obtenía, lo ahorraba para cualquier eventualidad. En el presente su tienda aumentó de tamaño, en donde exhibe una variedad de productos, con diferentes precios según la calidad del producto que necesita sus clientes. Su éxito fue la perseverancia que tuvo ante las adversidades que se le presentaba, es por ello que desea ampliar su negocio, con la finalidad de poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero a veces recibe la ayuda de sus hijas, trabajando desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus obligaciones, además no se arrepiente por nada del mundo por pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que lo viene trayendo beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería, con el propósito de cumplir con la demanda del cliente.
texts.en:
Videlmina is 41 years old, divorced, and has two children in school. They live together in their own wooden house in the town of San Francisco, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. When Videlmina opened her small store, she went through great expense to establish herself in the marketplace and attract customers. After some time, and with effort and determination, she was able to recover financially and earn enough money to save for emergencies. Her store has increased in size, which allows her to display a variety of products at different prices based on the quality of products that her customers need. Videlmina’s success is attributed to her perseverance in the face of adversity. Therefore she wants to expand her business in hopes of attracting more customers. She usually works alone, but sometimes she receives assistance from her daughters. Videlmina works from 6am until 9pm.

This is her third loan with MFP. Videlmina promises to continue paying her obligations. In addition, she does not regret being part of her Communal Bank since it has brought her many financial benefits. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie has been selling timber and this is her fifth successful year in this business.  Anathalie is 47 years old and married with two children.  The hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Anathalie, after realizing that she is not able to satisfy the demands of her customers because of an insufficient number of machines, would like to request one more additional machine which will allow her to cut more timber to sell.  Thus, she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers and she hopes that her profits will increase.  With these profits, Anathalie plans to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and a better future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase one additional machine for cutting timbers.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: afiwa est une jeune femme célibataire qui s'est lancé depuis plus de 5 ans déjà dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale; elle s'approvisionne au grand marché  de Lomé sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.elle veut gonfler son stock pour mieux vendre et accroître ses recettes. raison  pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 4 cartons de détergents, 3 sac de riz, 2 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers produits d'alimentation générale
texts.en:
Afiwa A. is a young unmarried woman who went into the business selling general food products five years ago. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. She would like to increase her stock so as to sell more and increase her earnings. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 4 cartons of detergent, 3 sacks of rice, 2 cartons of pasta and various general food products.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Imammaddin

texts.en: Imammaddin Q. is 35 years old and married. He has had a grocery store for 2 years; he started it with his own resources through his work. His wife is the one who works in the store. Imammaddin uses all his income to improve living conditions for his two children. He wants to increase the sales of new products preferred by his clients. He applied for a 900 AZN loan to purchase products such as bread, tinned goods, sweets and juices to increase his revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza B. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Specioza has owned and operated a beauty salon for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Specioza also sells beauty products at her shop. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids. The main business challenges for Specioza include electricity and transportation. Her business goal is to be able to buy a plot of land. Specioza lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria tiene 42 años, tiene su actividad que es la venta de productos varios como leña, bananos y otros. Por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo ella es una mujer responsable que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda para que su negocio avance. Este crédito que realiza es para la compra de materia prima como leña y bananos. Ella con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, por lo que sueña con ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana María, 42, sells various products like: firewood, plantains and others. She has a son in her care. She is a responsible woman who is always seeking ways to improve her income. This is not the first time she has negotiated loans because they have been of great use for her business’ progress. This loan will be used to buy firewood and plantains. She has managed to get ahead through much effort and she dreams with enlarging her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and plantains.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Guaraguaos, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., ubicado en la región Piura, a mas D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores, especialmente ganado ovino y aves D. corral, ella las alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y actualente tiene sembrado plantas D. mango. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan D. sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más animales y alimentos para criarlos, con esta acción piensa aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos. Para realizar su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Francisca es una mujer entregada a su familia y a su trabajo. Su día transcurre en el cuidado D. su hogar y en el cuidado D. sus animales. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisca, 53, is married and lives with her family in the Guaraguaos settlement, in a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of TambogranD., located in the Piura region, more than 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Francisca raises and sells small animals, particularly sheep and barnyard fowl.  She feeds the animals with grains and field grasses.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders in the area.  Her husband is a farmer and he is now planting mango plants.  With the income that they both earn they proviD. for their family.

She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and feed to raise them.  She thinks that this would increase her sales so that she could earn more.  To do this, she is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

Francisca is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and her work.  She spends her days caring for her home and for her animals.  The people who know her consider her to be a person who is calm and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy feed to raise them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock and raw materials for her business

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal U. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. They have been living in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and fence for the past 14 years. Three of her sons attend a local secondary school. 

Enhjargal and her husband operate three kinds of businesses to make their living. She has been operating a meat trading business in her town, with the help of her husband, since 1995 and they have built a stable operation. She offers a variety of locally produced meats, those purchased from herders, to her customers by selling at the local market. In addition, they operate a vegetable and fruit planting business to supplement their family's income. They planted a variety of vegetables in a 0.5 hectare field and fruits, such as gooseberries and sea buckthorns, in their yard. They sell these products in the local community. 

With profits from their fruit and vegetable trading business, she has been able to buy a new van (at 4,000,000 MNT) for her husband, who operates a transportation business. After years of successful businesses, her family's standard of living has been improving greatly year by year. They are both very hardworking people. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Samura

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Samura. He is married and has 3 children ages 9, 7, and 3. In 2005, Samura established his used clothing business. He began his business because it enabled him to support his family and his children's education. Working 4 days a week and 6 hours a day, he earns about Le 1200000 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 560,000. In the future, Samura plans to buy a vehicle and to establish a savings account. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou T. is from the city of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 41 years old. Marilou is widowed and has two school-age children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of different products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima B. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Fatima is married and has 5 school-aged children.
