To make a living, Fatima owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling confectionery products like "pop rice" & "otap" in the local community. Fatima has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fatima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fatima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fatima is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like banana chips. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Fatima from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like banana chips

loans.name: Joconda Jacqueline

texts.es:
Joconda Jacqueline R. R. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre vive con el compañero y  con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Joconda Jacqueline se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la estabilidad economica.

Le gusta viajar en especial a la playa.
texts.en: Joconda Jacqueline R. R. is 42. She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. She has 2 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Joconda Jacqueline works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. She purchases her products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to improve her economic stability. She enjoys traveling, especially to the beach.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia V. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Eusebia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall where she makes and sells a variety of meat dishes like chicken and pork adobo, chicken afritada and beef marrow soup in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eusebia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Eusebia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like pork, beef and chicken meat. This will be her 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like pork, beef and chicken meat

loans.name: The Chapel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama la Capilla se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Anenecuilco, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 11 personas que son vecinos y conocidos ellos son Antonia Gutiérrez Martínez va a comprar con su crédito frutas, verduras, para surtir su negocio, la señora Porfiria R. González va a comprar perfumes y cosméticos para su venta, la señora Araceli P. C. va a comprar calzado para su venta, la señora Ángela P. F. va a comprar colchas, cobertores, muebles de cocina, máquina de coser, gabinetes, para surtir su negocio, la señora Reyna C. Vélez va a comprar tela para hacer cortinas, vestido, etc. Para surtir su negocio, el señor Miguel C. P. va a comprar y vender artículos para el hogar, la señora Teresa F. E. va a comprar Dulces de todo tipo para surtir su negocio, la señora Guadalupe A. F. va a comprar refacciones para autos, y poder generar más movimientos, la señora Petra F. H. va a comprar frutas, verduras, como zanahorias, manzana, jitomate, tomate, etc. Para surtir su negocio, la señora Silvia Gutiérrez Sánchez va a comprar perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior,  etc. Para surtir su negocio y vender su mercancía, la señora Marciana N. B. va a comprar sus catálogos de la temporada para que pueda ofrecerlos y tenga sus primeras ventas. La señora Reyna C. Vélez tiene 70 años de edad, fue hasta el primer año de primaria, ella es viuda tiene 3 hijos Lorena de 48 años de edad es casada y está en los Estados unidos, Sergio tiene 38 años de edad es casada y vende en los tianguis ropa, Xochitl tiene 29 años de edad es casada y está en los estados unidos, la señora Reyna tiene su negocio de confección de prendas de vestir y sabanas y venta por catalogo de Fuller y solicito su préstamo para comprar tela para elaborar sabanas, ella ofrece a sus clientes confección de prendas de vestir uniformes, pantalones, vestidos, blusas.  Ella inicio su negocio hace 53 años confeccionando ropa y con la venta de Fuller y stanhome inicio hace 4 años.  Ella inicio su negocio  por iniciativa propia y la necesidad, ella trabajo en un taller de costura haciendo los terminados, pegando botones, cierres, bastillas, planchado, con un aguinaldo que le dieron en el taller donde trabajaba compro tela y su máquina de coser, hilos, cintas, cierres, botones  y fue como inicio con su negocio. Su negocio es importante porque de ahí se sostiene económicamente de ahí paga todos los gastos, la luz, el agua, todo le gusta de su negocio y le da gran satisfacción u orgullo que ha podida salir adelante con todos sus hijos y sus nietos y está muy orgullosa de su negocio, sus clientes son muchos de todo tiene, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para sus gastos, para comprar más tela y figurines. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar más tela para elaborar mas sabanas y salir a venderlas y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo que le hicieron. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a sacar a sus hijos adelante a su casa a ir Haciendo detalles para su casa le puso lamina de asbesto por que la tenia de cartón, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son ponerle piso y repellar su casa, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir trabajando, terminar su casa, echarle colado y le va a ayudar a su hijo con la cal y el cemento lo piensa hacer con las ganancias del negocio, ella está muy feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque va a surtir su negocio. Ella está pensando ayudarle a su hijo a desplantar su casa a construir su casa y lo piensa lograr con las ganancias de su negocio. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos muy agradecidos con su apoyo que nos dieron y gracias, les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan de obtener este crédito y esperamos que su corazón siempre este presto para seguir ayudando a más personas que lo necesitan”. En Anenecuilco se encuentra la casa museo de Emiliano Zapata hay cuadros, artículos personales del general Emiliano Zapata pasan una película con la historia, el 8 de agosto se celebra el Nacimiento de Emiliano zapata el día 7 hacen una velada con bailables, cantantes en la primaria Emiliano Zapata y después se van a la casa museo de Emiliano Zapata a dar la mañanitas. También se celebra el 5º. Domingo de semana santa al señor Jesús de Anenecuilco, hay misas, van los danzantes, hay procesión.
texts.en:
This group is named La Capilla and it is located in the community of Anenecuilco in the state of Morelos in Mexico. It is made up of 11 individuals who are neighbors and friends. 

Antonia G. M. will invest her loan in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to supply her store. 

Porfiria R. G. will purchase perfumes and cosmetics for resale. 

Araceli P. C. will purchase shoes for resale. 

Angela P. F. will purchase blankets, bed spreads, kitchen furniture, a sewing machine, and cabinets to supply her store. 

Reyna C. V. will purchase fabric to make curtains, dresses, etc. 

Miguel C. P. will purchase items for the home to supply his store. 

Teresa F. E. will purchase all types of sweets to supply her store. 

Guadalupe Alvaro F. will purchase automotive spare parts in order to increase her sales. 

Petra F. H. will purchase fruits and vegetables, including carrots, apples, tomatoes, etc. to supply her store. 

Sylvia G. S. will purchase cosmetics, perfumes, undergarments, etc. to supply her store and to resell the merchandise. 

Marciana N. B. will purchase catalogues for the season to use them and make the first sales of the season. 

Reyna C. V. is 70 years old and she has a grade one education. She is a widow and she has 3 children: Lorena is 48 years old and she is married. She lives in the USA. Sergio is 38 years old and is married and he sells clothing in the market. Xochitl is 29 years old and she is married. She also lives in the USA. Reyna has a seamstress business, making articles of clothing and bed sheets. She also makes sells through a Fuller brand catalogue. She requests a loan to purchase fabrics to make bed sheets. She offers her clients to make articles of clothing including uniforms, pants, dresses, and blouses. She started her business 53 years ago and the Fuller and Stanhope catalogue sales she started 4 years ago. 

She started her business under her own initiative and for personal need. She works in a sewing shop, doing detail work, sewing buttons, zippers, hems, and pleats. With a pension that she received from a shop where she used to work she purchased fabrics, a sewing machine, threads, ribbons, zippers, and buttons, and that's how she started her business.  Her business is important because she is able to support herself financially and she is able to pay all her expenses, including hydro and water. She likes everything about her work and it gives her great personal satisfaction and pride to have been able to provide for her children and grandchildren. She is very proud of her business. She has many clients and they ask for all types of things. The profits from her business are used to pay for her expenses, to purchase more fabrics and appliqués. 

She plans on expanding her business by purchasing more fabrics to make bed sheets destined for sale and she plans on doing this with her loan. Through her business she has been able to support her children and the house. She has been improving her house, including changing the cardboard tiles to asbestos sheets. The improvement she wants to make to her house now is to install a floor and to plaster the walls. 

Her plan and her hope is to keep working and to finish building her house by putting in some concrete. She will help her son with the purchase of lime and cement with the income from her business. She is very happy with this loan because she is able to supply her business. She is thinking about helping her son replace his house and to build a new one. She plans on doing this with the profits from her business. 

The members of this group wish to convey the following message to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner). "We are thankful for the support you have given us. We appreciate the opportunity that you have given us to access this loan and we hope that your heart will always be ready to help even more people who are in need." 

The Emiliano Zapata museum is found in Anenecuilco. There are paintings and personal artifacts of General Emiliano Zapata. They also show a historical film. Emiliano Zapata's birthday is commemorated on August 8 and on the seventh day there is a candlelight ceremony and a dance. A group of singers start their tour at the Emiliano Zapata primary school and travel to the Emiliano Zapata museum to sing La Mananitas (a version. The fifth week of Holy Week is also celebrated in Jesus Anenecuilco. There are masses, dancers, and a procession.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah C. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Leah is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish such as sardines & salmon in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Leah is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell such as sardines & salmon. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Leah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell such as sardines & salmon

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es: Rosa Adilia tiene 38 años. Solamente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, su actividad económica de ella es una pulpería esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años la necesidad de proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario es lo que a ella le motiva a continuar día a día con este medio de vida.  Este crédito es para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos naturales, granos básicos, pan, galletas entre otros. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Rosa Adilia, 38, has two children in her care.  She has a grocery store, an activity she’s had for four years.  The need to provide her family with the necessities of life motivates her to continue day to day with this way of earning a living.

This loan is to buy snacks, natural beverages, basic grains, bread and cookies, among others.  Her greatest wish is to enlarge the business in such a way that it will allow her to improve her family’s economic situation and provide her children with the best possible education.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Eleno

texts.es:
El Sr. Eleno tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. María Lorenza de 40 años de edad, llevan 18 años juntos y tienen 2 hijos, uno en edad escolar y el otro ya mayor de edad.
El desde muy temprana edad viajó con su hermano que trabajaba como constructor en Argentina, para trabajar como ayudante, ahí es donde aprendió, después de mucho tiempo de trabajar como ayudante decidió trabajar por cuenta propia como  constructor. 
Hace 19  años, con el dinero que juntó trabajando en Argentina regresó a Paraguay y se compró todas la herramientas necesarias para trabajar por cuenta propia, hoy día prácticamente es el único constructor de obra dentro de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de implementos (herramientas) puesto que tiene muchos trabajos en esta época.
texts.en:
Sr. Eleno is 41 years old and married to Sra. María Lorenzo, age 40. They have been together for 18 years and raised two children. One child is of school age and the other is an adult.

At an early age, Eleno traveled with his brother to Argentina to work in construction as an assistant. He learned on the job while he was there. After a long time of working as an assistant, he decided to become independent and work as a builder.

When he was 19, Eleno returned to Paraguay with the money he earned while working in Argentina. He bought all the equipment he needed to work on his own. Today he is practically the only builder in the city of Carapeguá.

Eleno is requesting a loan to buy tools since has many jobs scheduled this season.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude N. est journaliste u radio locale, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il est célibataire, ne au Rwanda, et Jean Marie a fini ses études jusqu’au niveau A0 en journalisme.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour paiement de minerval pour ses études de maitrise, alors il peut avoir un nouveau bon emploi, et pouvoir élever sa capacité financière.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de chercher tous les moyens pour trouver d’autres sources de financement.  Il voudrait avoir une ferme, et pour la vie, il voudrait occuper sa famille, construire une maison pour eux, et aussi éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Claude N. is a local radio journalist, and a client of ACB since 2008. He is single and was born in Rwanda. He completed A0 level journalism studies. 

He will use his loan to pay the tuition fees for his master’s degree in order to find an even better job and increase his earning capacity. His financial strategy is to seek every funding source available. He would like to own a farm, and in the long term, he wants to look after his family, build a house for them, and give his children an education.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for his master’s degree

loans.name: Bayar-Erdene

texts.en:
Bayar-Erdene is 26 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in his parents' back yard. His wife, who recently gave birth to twin children, stays home looking after their children. 

He manages an animal rawhide trading business in his town. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his brother-in-law. In 2007, he sold all his husbandry animals and bought a mini-truck to be used in transporting his collected raw materials to his customers. He is a serious man who says, "I am doing my best to feed my family." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal rawhides for his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal rawhides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to be sold.

loans.name: Ruth Gathoni

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 24 years. She is 53 years old, married to Michael K., and they have 3 children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and pay for labor.

In the future, Ruth hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a married woman with three adult-aged children. She is 60 years old and has had a business selling fruits and vegetables for 13 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.
 
Lucrecia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and squash to sell.

In the future, Lucrecia hopes that her business will become more progressive to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, cabbage and squash to sell

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mr. Nem is a 29-year-old villager who has a job as a local fisherman along the river in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. He has been running his fishing business for over three years and is earning approximately $3 a day.

His wife is a sewing worker at the garment factory and she gets a paycheck each month to use for cash expenses. The humble couple has a child who is still not in school. 

Mr. Nem is applying for a loan to purchase small fishes for breeding. With this, the family can increase their income and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase small fish for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to puchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of them currently in school. Ismail has a clothes business, which he has had for six years. He also has a second business of selling produce like beans, maize.  

To help expand his business, Ismail has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ismail hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to get a sewing machine and start making clothes himself.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 48 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has two children who are 2 and 10 years old. Both of them are attending school. For the past five years now, she has been selling Lappa (a traditional cloth) and slippers in the local market. Sometimes she faces a lot of problems with the hiking of prices. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa and slippers for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa and slippers to sell

loans.name: Mauro Jesus

texts.es:
Mauro de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican específicamente al comercio y crianza de aves de corral.

Mauro  maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran competencia que existe realizando el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y renovación de llantas y carpa que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mauro es una persona que con esfuerzo y trabajador  desea que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mauro, 51, lives with his wife and children in his own home, which has the basic utilities of water and electricity.  He lives in an urban area of the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is in Chiclayo province.  The residents of this area tend to work raising poultry and in retail trade.

Mauro has had his own mototaxi (a light vehicle used to move a maximum of 3 people short distances) for several years.  He works in the same neighborhood where he lives.  In spite of all of the competitors in this same line of work, he tries as hard as possible to transport a good quantity of passengers to their various destinations starting in the early morning.  In this way, he can have a higher income to pay for the household expenses and necessities.

Mauro has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles, which he will use to maintain and replace his tires and the canopy of his mototaxi.  He needs these items to continue to provide good service to his customers and improve the quality of life of his family.  Mauro is a person who, with hard work and effort, wants his children to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to maintain/replace the tires and canopy of his mototaxi

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 50 years old, is a sugar palm maker with her husband. Their income is $4 per day. She has four children, one is studying and two are working and also earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $41 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent for their house, $3 on school fees, $10 on transportation costs, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her son to start a motor taxi service. In the future, she hopes her children can have their own careers to support themselves and she wants to be able to send her last child to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to start a motor taxi service

loans.name: Hector Emilio

texts.es:
Héctor es un señor de 26 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Las Bonitas de Platanares, localizada en Pérez Zeledón esto en la provincia de San Jose. Es una zona donde se presenta la actividad agropecuaria, los habitantes de la región en su mayoría son productores de café y de ganado doble propósito.

El tiene el apoyo de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Héctor Emilio es un micro crédito de ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones), para compra de cerdos para engorde, para obtener un mejor resultado en su proyecto.

Don Héctor Emilio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de las Bonitas, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas, y se tiene más información y acceso a créditos ya que con las entidades bancarias es muy difícil.
texts.en:
Héctor is a 26-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and children in the community of Las Bonitas de Platanares, which is located in Pérez Zeledón in the Province of San Jose. This is an agricultural area, so most of the residents in this region are coffee producers and livestock breeders.

Héctor has the support of his wife, which makes it easier for him to continue with his project. In addition to being very interesting work, his business has grown gradually and the demand gets stronger each time. His neighbors in the community are satisfied with the service that he provides.

At the moment, Don Héctor Emilio is requesting a microloan in the amount of 500,000 CRC in order to buy pigs for fattening so that he can obtain a better result in his project.

Don Héctor Emilio is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of Las Bonitas, one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan, he hopes to grow on a personal and financial level. In addition, he expresses his appreciation to these types of organizations and credit facilitators that devote a great amount of time to productive activities. Having more information and getting access to credit is usually very difficult with the banking institutions.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Alexandra Beatriz

texts.es:
La señorita Alexandra es una persona joven, soltera, sin hijos que estudia y trabaja en un Autoservicio como cajera, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Pilar. 
Está cursando actualmente el primer año de  la carrera de Ciencias Ambientales de la Facultad, en la Universidad Nacional de Pilar. Ella comenta que le va muy bien en sus estudios ya que le gusta lo que está estudiando, ya que día a día se esfuerza. Comenta que su sueño es terminar la universidad de la mejor forma posible y luego poder servir a la sociedad y a sus padres que tanto la han ayudado en sus proyectos y metas.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pago de materiales y cuotas de sus estudios para poder rendir sus exámenes finales. Está agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues esto es muy importante para ella, ya que sus estudios son muy importantes.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young single person without children. She studies and works at supermarket as a cashier. She lives without her parents in the city of Pilar.   

She is currently in her first year of study in the Environment Studies College in the National University of Pilar. She says she's doing well in her studies,  that she likes what she's studying, and that each day she puts forth effort. She says her dream is to finish at the university in the best possible way and later she can give back to society and to her parents who have helped her so much in her plans and goals.  

She asks for a loan to pay for study materials and fees to be able to take her final exams. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity given to her, since this is very important to her and her studies are very important.

loans.use: to pay for university materials and fees.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una panadería, la
socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,leche entre otros productos y el negocio de panadería lo realiza su esposo, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y también insumos para hacer pan como harinas, mantequilla y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “AMANECER ANTEÑA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province, in Cusco department.

The member is Señora Jovita; she is 48 years old and is married with four children. The member combines her daily activities with her businesses of a grocery store and also a bakery.  The member sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, and milk among other products, and the her husband manages the bakery.  The member works from 6 a.m. till 6 p.m., and by means of these businesses the member has been able to move her children ahead in life.

The member would like to expand her grocery store business and her bakery business.  She is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles, and also supplies for baking bread such as flour, butter, and sugar.

The member is happy about the loan and agrees to comply with the repayments.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles, and also supplies for baking bread such as flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 37 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos.

Manuel se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde pequeño. Su padre fue quien le enseñó a cultivar maíz y maicillo. Actualmente Manuel cultiva independientemente para venta y para consumo en su hogar. Manuel cultiva en una parcela que queda a 3 kilometros de distancia de su casa. Para llevar su cosecha a su casa, Manuel tiene que subir una cuesta con todo su producto. Por esta razón, él necesita la ayuda de un par de novillos que acarreen la carga. En éste momento Manuel no tiene una yunta de novillos propia, por lo que él le paga a terceros por dicho servicio. A veces el tener que contratar un tercero causa atrazos en su trabajo, ya que durante la época de cosecha los dueños de novillos tienen mucha demanda por sus servicios.

Manuel solicitó un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de una yunta de novillos. Teniendo una yunta propia Manuel no tendrá que pagar a alguien más para realizar su trabajo. De ésta manera él no tendrá demoras en su producción, y podra trabajar más eficientemente por su cuenta. Teniendo la yunta de novillos Manuel podrá vivir y trabajar más tranquilamente, y así darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37, married, and has four children. 

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was a child. His father taught him to grow corn and sorghum. Manuel farms independently both to sell and to consume at home. Manuel cultivates a plot that is 3 kilometers from his house. To bring his harvest home, Manuel has to go uphill with all of his goods. Because of this, he needs the help of a pair of young bulls to transport the load. Presently, Manuel does not have his own yoke of young bulls, so he has to pay a third party for the service. Sometimes having to hire a third party delays his work, since during harvest time, the owners of young bulls have a lot of demand for their services. 

Manuel requests a loan from the Fundación Campo [Rural Foundation] to purchase a yoke of young bulls. With his own yoke, Manuel will not have to pay anyone else in order to do his work. This way, he won’t have delays in his production and will be able to work more efficiently on his behalf. With the yoke of young bulls, Manuel will be able to live and work more peacefully, and this way, provide for all the needs of his children.

loans.use: purchase a yoke of young bulls to carry his harvest.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en: Janneh is 20 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is single and has a 6-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past four years, she has been selling meat in the local market. She likes how people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 34 years old and has four children all of which are in school.  She has had a business as a hotel server in Kator, South Sudan for the past six years. She is married to a business man.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and beans for her business.  She will use her profits from this loan to build a concrete house in order to extend the hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Mariela Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariela es de la ciudad de San Santaní, vive con su madre, es soltera y tiene 23 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de camisas, remeras, zapatos y otro tipo de artículos. Nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que  recorre por la ciudad  y también por las compañías vecinas, gracias a su arduo esfuerzo logra tener buen ingreso. 
Ella trabaja mucho, para que algún día pueda tener un local propio y no tenga que recorrer más. Está muy a gusto con su trabajo por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que solicita la ayuda de la fundación, para la compra de camisas, remeras, zapatos y otros con lo cual podrá abastecerse y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Mariela is 23 years old and lives in the city of San Santani with her mother.  Mariela works selling women's clothing and shoes to nearby companies as well as around the city.   She tells us that her business requires hard work, as she must traverse much of the city.  Thanks to her efforts she has been able to generate good income.  She works a lot so that one day she will be able to have her own shop, rather than selling door to door.  Mariela likes her work and would like to continue to grow the business.  She is requesting support from the foundation to purchase blouses, shoes and other clothing items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 38, is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, she has had a café business, operating from the nearby town where town dwellers and neighbors are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Grace dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and salt for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, oil, sugar, and salt for her cafe.

loans.name: Leon

texts.en:
Leon is 45 years of age, an optimistic, jolly and industrious farmer in their community. He said that,"we should be positive and happy always though there are a lot of trials that we encounter every day" and maybe this is the reason why looks younger than his real age.

He wants to develop more his business because he is dreaming to finish his three children in their studies. This lead him to ask a loan amount P15,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. This loan would be a big help in growing his business plus his patience and hard work. He believe that when he work  hard and trust our creator, he would then achieve success.

Hopefully, he could uplift his family out of poverty and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 33, is a married woman with three children. She lives in Tinacla-an, a neighborhood of Clarin in the province of Misamis Occidental.

For the past ten years Lourdes has planted, harvested and sold bananas to earn a living. Each month she earns 5,000 PHP from doing so.

Lourdes has been a member of GDMPC for almost four years. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

In the future, Lourdes wants to make improvements on her house and put her children through school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and has 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 53 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Anita has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Anita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Anita has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and has one child. For the past two years, she has sold rice porridge and saucepans at Asebu Brebia. Regina's husband works at a gas filling station. Regina uses her income to help her husband support their family and provide for their general upkeep. 

Regina is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice to prepare porridge and to buy more saucepans to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make porridge and buy saucepans to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is a farmer from the town of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with six children. She has been in the farming business for 15 years. This is the main source of her income. Rosalina is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice production. With this loan, She will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus she can harvest as many as they can so that they can provide the needs of their children especially the education . In the future,Rosalina hopes to make her farming business more productive and abundant so that they can provide all the needs of their family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice production

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Javier Alfredo

texts.en:
Javier is young, responsable, and hard-working. His business is an auto repair and paint shop; he began this business when faced with the need to have work when he lost his last job. Currently, Javier is married; he does not have children but he is planning to. So he wants to continue working to offer them a better quality of life and an education in the future. Right now his repair shop has two employees so not only does Javier`family depend on the repair shop, but two other families also depend on the repair shop`s income. He needs $475.00 USD to buy material and tools that will enable him to improve the time and quality of his work; in this way he hopes his clientele increases and more income is generated. Javier plans to return the loan between 3 to 6 months. He requests your support and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier es una persona joven, responsable y trabajadora, su negocio consiste en el servicio de enderezado y pintura de carros; inicio este negocio ante la necesidad de tener un empleo ya que el último empleo que había tenido lo había perdido por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio. En la actualidad Javier esta casado, no tiene hijos pero esta planeando tener algunos, por lo que desea seguir trabajando para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una educación en el futuro. Hasta el momento su taller tiene 2 empleados por lo que no solo la familia de Javier subsiste con el funcionamiento de su taller, sino que además hay otras 2 familias que también subsisten de los ingresos que su taller obtiene.

El requiere de $475 USD para comprar material y herramientas que le permitirá mejorar el tiempo y la calidad de su trabajo, de esta manera el espera que sus clientes aumenten y obtengan mayores ingresos. Javier planea regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3-6 meses por lo que pide tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase Materials

loans.name: Bairam

texts.en: Bairam S. is 29 years old. He is single and lives in the village of Muldava, near Asenovgrad. Bairam has had a farming business since 2000. Then he has bought a cowshed from the previous state agricultural company in Asenovgrad and started breeding cows. Now 6 years later he has 23 cows in his farm. Because the cowshed is old and needs repairs Bairam S. applies for a $1200 loan. He will refit the cowshed roof and will build some partition walls to separate his cows.

loans.use: To refit the cowshed roof and build some partition walls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy charcoal, rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with a teenage daughter. She and her family live in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Yuliya sells plants and flowers in the city market. There is not much competition in this sphere of trade. 

Yuliya has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, her monthly net profit is about $400. Yuliya is very active and energetic. All of her previous loans were repaid without defaults. Her success is the direct result of thoughtful planning and structured investments. 

Yuliya is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her turnover capital so that she can buy flowers for further retail sale. She wants to purchase more flowers wholesale as she knows they bring joy to many people’s homes. She would like to see additional growth in her small venture. We believe her responsibility and managerial skills will help her use this loan wisely and repay it on time.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy E. is a 30 year old woman who sells food items, drinks, and provisions to people. She is married and the mother of two children and lives in Benin City in the Edo state of Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan amount of $400 to buy food items, drinks, and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more food items, drinks, & provisions for sales

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en: Shahbaz (his brother is pictured) was born in 1986. This single  man lives in the Khachmaz region, in Hadjialibay village.  Shahbaz and his brother have a fruit orchard. They want to improve their business; that is why they request a loan of $1200. The guys plan to buy fruit seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer for improving their yield. These young guys have  been in this business for two years.

loans.use: To buy fruit seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is 37 years old  and owns an accessories and perfume store in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. She is an independent, self-reliant and confident person. She and her fiance are building a home for themselves. This loan is Souad's third from Al Majmoua-- she will use the loan to purchase new merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is 47 years old and lives with her family in the Borj Barajneh region of Lebanon. Nada makes a living working as a sales agent for a wide range of products used by the people in her area. She has come to us for a loan to replenish the inventory of items she has to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Imamil

texts.en: Imamil (her husband is pictured) was born in 1962 and is the mother of four children.  She and her family live in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. They are requesting a loan of $475 to purchase an additional calf for their business of ten years.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en:
M. Firdavs is 27 years old. He is married with three children. Firdavs is a farmer working the land. He has been in this business for 8 years. Firdavs grows such agricultural crops like potato and carrots. Considering that the business is the main source of income for Firdavs, he is working hard in order to make the business stable and successful.

Firdavs is planning to purchase seeds and fertilizer. With this purpose he's requesting $900 for the term of 9 months. This is Firadvs's second loan and he promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support and trust.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina was born in 1966 and she lives with her husband and two children in Klokotnica, a suburb of the town of Doboj. Her husband is a demobilized soldier and he is unemployed. Mina works in a factory as a tyipist. Her husband gets an additional salary of 150 KM per month as a demobilized soldier. One of her sons attends university and the other one attends secondary school.

This is her first loan in the amount of 600 KM. Mina intends to use it to buy food for her livestock. Her wish is to expand her livestock business in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: For buying food for the livestock.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia began with the sale of sodas, fried snacks, frozen popsicles, ball point pens, and sweet bread in a small room of her home. After this, with the small profits that came from the sales and with the help of her family, she built a bigger location and began the sale of groceries. This has created good profits, but she wants to have her store well stocked in order that all the clients that come in needing something will easily be able to find it in her store.

She needs a loan of $300 that she will repay in 6 months. In order to buy merchandise and display cases and in order to have a sign in front of her business and thus gain publicity. She tells us that with the help of Kiva she will be able to attain her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia inicio con la venta de refrescos, frituras, paletas de nieves, bolis y bollos, en un pequeño cuarto de su hogar. Después con las pocas ganancias que le dejaba la venta y con la ayuda de sus familiares construyo un local más amplio e inicio la venta de abarrotes lo que le ha dejado buenas ganancias, pero ella desea tener su tienda bien surtida para que todos los clientes que lleguen a su tienda y necesiten de algo lo encuentren fácilmente con ella.

Ella necesita de un crédito de $300 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía, compra de exhibidores y para rotular la parte de enfrente de su negocio y así tener publicidad, ella confía que con el apoyo de Kiva podrá lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a sign

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda and Justino are a young couple, but their incomes do not allow them to finish high school. Since they came together, they have only thought about getting ahead and providing for the well-being of their two-year-old daughter, Sonia. They left their native town, Pusi, with the hope of improving their quality of life. Now, with strength and determination, they are succeeding. They make beautiful, comfortable chairs and collapsible tables that they distribute in various furniture stores in the city of Juliaca. This couple wants to secure a loan to invest in the purchase of more materials and fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda y Justino son una pareja de esposos muy jóvenes pero sus posibilidades económicas no les permitieron concluir sus estudios secundarios, desde que se unieron sólo tuvieron en mente salir adelante y ofrecerle bienestar a su pequeña niña, Sonia de 2 añitos de edad.Salieron de su pueblo natal, Pusi, con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida y ahora con esfuerzo y empeño lo están logrando.Se dedican a la fabricación de hermosas y cómodas sillas y mesas plegables que distribuyen en las diversas mueblerías de la ciudad de Juliaca, el deseo de esta pareja es obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales y cumplir sus deseos.

loans.use: To raise capital to purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andres is a devoted father of a family and very hard worker. He shows it everyday on his farm, investing a lot of time in improving his production and harvesting fruits to sell in the markets. Without a doubt, all of his work has a purpose, which is to be able to have better income so that he can keep up with the education costs for his children, who attend high school in the capitol, Lima.

They are the reason that Andres desires to improve his production and invest in more coffee plants, bananas, and other diverse fruits that are profitable in the area. Andres wants to be able to transport the same fruits to sell in other nearby cities. For this he asks for a loan of $375, money that he guarantees will be invested in, and of great help to, his production. He hopes, with all his heart that, you can help this humble father who wants only the best for his children.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer

Andrés es un entregado padre de familia y empeñoso trabajador, lo demuestra todos los días en sus terrenos de cultivo, invierte gran tiempo en la mejora de su producción y en la cosecha de frutos para vender en los mercados. Sin duda todo este trabajo tiene un propósito, el cual es poder tener mayores ingresos para que pueda solventar los gastos de sus hijos quienes cursan estudios superiores en la capital, Lima. Son por estas razones que Andrés tiene el deseo de mejorar su producción e invertir en mayores plantaciones de café, plátano y otras diversidades de frutas que son rentables en la zona. Andrés desea poder trasladar él mismo a otras ciudades cercanas sus productos para venderlos. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que le garantiza será debidamente invertido y de gran ayuda para su producción, esperamos de todo corazón que usted pueda ayudar a este humilde padre que desea lo mejor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Captial to invest in expanding his sales of fruit to nearby cities in the area.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin worked in the countryside for many years. Upon seeing that the economic situation was poor, he moved to Reynosa, Tamaulipas to look for a job, so that he would have more opportunities. He found work, and little by little saved money until he was able to begin a repair shop. Little by little he has increased his income until today he is able to meet his spending and pay for his children's education.

Martin is now asking for a $400 loan which he will repay in 6 months to purchase material. He is hopeful that with Kiva's support he will obtain it.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Martín trabajo en el campo por mucho tiempo, al ver que la situación económica era muy carente, emigro a Reynosa, Tamaulipas, en cuanto llego empezó a buscar trabajo ya que así tenía más posibilidades de solventar sus gastos. Encontró trabajo, poco a poco se fue haciendo de sus ahorros, hasta que decidió poner una vulcanizadora. Poco a poco le ha ido dejando buenos ingresos, que hasta hoy en día a podido solventar todos los gastos económicos y la educación de sus hijos.

Hoy en día esta solicitando de un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de material, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
Rosa Elia hace 3 años empezó con el negocio ya que sus hijos crecieron y cada uno tomo su camino, así que ella necesitaba dedicarse alguna actividad que le generara ingresos, por lo cual empezó con su negocio aparte de que es de gran además para su economía la mantiene activa, y así ha ido prosperando poco a poco con su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así surtir mas la tienda y vender mas para crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Three year sago Rosa Elia started her business as each of her kids had gone their own way. This is why she needed to do something to generate more income for herself, and by starting this business she has remained active as well as earning some extra income. Her bric-a-brac shop has prospered bit by bit.

She needs a loan of $575 (which she will repay over a period of 6 months) to buy merchandise and thereby stock out her shop more and sell more so that her business can grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/compra mercancia

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en:
R. Nukra is 34 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of two children. Nukra is selling toys for children. She has rented a store in one of the local markets and has run her own small business for five years. The business is the main source of income for her large family; Nukra and her husband not only support their two children but also their parents. Having only a couple competitors in the market, she is doing well with her business. Nukra always dreamed of owning her own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. She believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own store. 

Today, she is requesting a loan of 2400 Somoni (725 USD) for the term of 12 months. She will use the money to purchase new toys and increase the range of goods she sells. Nukra thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan payment. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream come reality.

loans.use: to purchase toys and increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam B. has been selling pots in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more pots to sell.

Mariam is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 4 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more pots to sell for her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 52 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Compañía community, forty minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho.

Irene has a store in her home where she sells dry goods, vegetables and fruits as well as a small restaurant, which she just opened last week. Her daughter helps her with both businesses. Irene needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy rice, sugar, oil, and soap. Irene dreams of expanding her business and improving her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Irene es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Irene vive en la comunidad D. Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Irene tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas y además tiene un pequeño restaurante negocio que inicio hace 1 semana, cuenta con la ayuda D. su hija para atención D. ambos negocios.

Irene necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite y jabón. Los sueños D. Irene son que su negocio crezca, mejorar su restaurante.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, and soap

loans.name: Chres

texts.en:
Mr. Chres M. is a 63-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. He makes a living catching fish to sell in the market in and around Tunle Sap Lake, which currently earns him a revenue of around US$ 3 a day. He has been in this business since 1990. He has eight children; four are single and four are married. Two of his daughters are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a national lottery agent; both are getting salaries of US$ 160 a month and also contribute to covering the family's living expenses.

Mr. Chres M.'s wife, Meas Pholly, 53, is a rice farmer. M. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for his daughters to ride to work. (M.'s wife appears in the picture, because M. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 6 años en su propia casa. Desde hace un año se dedica a vender cigarros, distribuye al por mayor, viaja a las ciudades aledañas a su localidad como Huancavelica, Pampas o otras en la zona de selva, con su vital herramienta de trabajo que es su pequeña combi (como se la ve en la foto). Este negocio le es rentable, lo que la motiva a seguir dedicándose a ello, los días viernes se abastece de mercadería y los demás días hace sus repartos. Su meta es tener varios negocios, uno de ellos, era lo anteriormente hacía, que era vender prendas tejidas. Es la quinta vez que Leticia tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ha aprendido durante este tiempo el trabajo en equipo dentro de su banco comunal y a pesar de que su primer grupo se disolvió, ella y otros socios decidieron formar otro banquito. Con el dinero solicitado va a comprar una caja de cigarros valorizada en 1200 soles, que será suficiente para abastecerse de mercadería y el resto del dinero será un capital para imprevistos.
texts.en:
Leticia is 31 years old, lives with her husband and 6 year old son in their own home. She has been selling cigarettes for a year. She is a wholesale distributor, traveling to neighboring cities such as Huancavelica, Pampa or other areas of the jungle, with her most important tool of her work which is her small van (which is seen in the photograph). This business is profitable, and that motivates her to continue working. On Fridays she stocks us with merchandise and on the other days she makes her deliveries. Her goal is to have various businesses, one of them is something she previously did, which was selling various sewn articles of clothing. This is the 5th time Leticia is receiving a loan from MFP, she has learned during this time to work with others from within her communal bank and in spite of the fact that her first group dissolved, she and other members decided to form another communal bank. With the loan money she is going to buy a case of cigarettes valued at 1200 soles, which will be sufficient to stock her supply and the rest of the money will be used for unforeseen expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Bertha es casada, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos, Bertha vende condimentos al por mayor, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Huanta a donde viaja 2 veces por semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ajo por sacos.
Los sueños de Bertha son terminar de construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Bertha is 29 years old, married and has 4 children. Bertha sells seasonings mainly. She sells in the city of Huanta where she travels twice a week. She buys her products in the city of Lima. Bertha needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sacks of garlic. Bertha dreams of being able to build her house and buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of garlic

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Yusufjon K. just turned 37 not so recently. He and his wife have raised two children. For six years Yusufjon has been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. Yusufjon’s eldest son helps him with the business. Yusufjon is respected and known in the neighborhood as a real master and this reputation has allowed him to earn a clientele. The business is stable and is generating the main income for the family. Today Yusufjon needs to purchase input materials such as lumber for his business. He is also planning to improve the working conditions of the business. In order to accomplish these tasks he requests a loan of $1100 USD with a term of 12 months. Considering that this is the first loan for Yusufjon he thanks all lenders for supporting and trusting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, its culture is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and its manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing wood and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Darly Luz

texts.es:
DARLY LUZ A. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz. I Lt. 7 del Distrito de Callaría, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, y su pareja es conductor de vehículos mayores.

El primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300 nuevo soles, los invirtió en abrir una pequeña bodega, tiene un año trabajando con Manuela Ramos y está progresando en su bodega, en este tiempo ha podido hacer buenos clientes, ella esta consciente que una buena atención es lo que hace que el cliente vuelva, y también que no falte nada en su tienda.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300. Nuevos Soles, va realizar sus compras al por mayor, ya que tiene guardado un poco de dinero y con este préstamo va incrementarlo y surtir muy bien su tienda, por lo que ha hecho una lista de todo lo que le está faltando y los productos que ya se están agotando. Siempre está atenta a las ofertas que salen para traerlos a sus clientes.

Le agrada que en la región se haya instalado Manuela Ramos y se siente feliz de que haya una ONG, especialmente pensando en las mujeres.
texts.en:
DARLY LUZ A. C. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives on Miraflores Ave in the Callao District. She is a 35-year-old mother of 2 and her partner is a truck driver.

With the first loan she received of 300 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.), she invested in starting up a small grocery store. She's been working with Manuela Ramos for a year and in that time has been able to grow her business, amassing a loyal clientele. She is conscious of the fact that providing a customer with good service and keeping the store well stocked means a repeat customer.

With this loan of 1,300 soles and her own savings, Darly is going to invest in wholesale merchandise to stock her store. She has already made a list of products she wants to buy and those she is running low on. She's always on the lookout for good offers and products she can pass on to her customers.

She is pleased that a Manuel Ramos is operating in her area and is happy that there is an ONG dedicated to helping women.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ehson

texts.ru: Эхсон - молодой мужчина 29 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Эхсон занимается продажей разного вида масла на рынке Панчшанбе. Его жена домохозяйка. Эхсон единственный человек в семье, который зарабатывает деньги, чтобы прокормить свою семью. Он закупает товар у оптовиков в этом-же рынке и целый день продает товар в розницу. Этим он зарабатывает на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей и дать им образование. За эти 2 года он расширил свой бизнес, и за каждый займ благодарит организацию за помощь.
texts.en:
Ehson is a young man of 29. He is married and has three children. Ehson sells various kinds of cooking oil at the Panchshanbe market. His wife is a housewife. Ehson is the only person in the family to earn money to feed the family. He buys goods wholesale and all day long sells them retail. Doing so, he is able to earn a living in order to feed his children and give them an education. In the past two years he has expanded his business and is grateful to the organization for the assistance provided with each loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sale of cooking oil

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
soltera, tiene 2 hijos.

Se dedica a la venta de calzado, por catalogo.

como madre soltera en la busqueda de mayores ingresos comenzo con las ventas, gracias a una invitacion que le hicieron, empezo a ver que le dejaba ganacia, ya tiene sus clientes, los cuales le solicitan , ciertos modelos de zapato y necesita comprarlos en la distribuidora y asi poder ella venderlos.

ha salido adelante, como madre y padre que es en su hogar, apoyemos este caso, no paremos sus ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Soltera has 2 children. As a single mother who is trying to increase her income, she sells footwear by catalogue. She got into sales because of an invitation she received and she began to see that she was making money. She now has clients who place orders for different types of shoes that she buys from a distributor and then sells. She has been doing well. Since she is both mother and father in this home, we support her case. We will not stand in the way of her desire to get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Lorna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP (US$150), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Kariati Group

texts.en:
Fatuma has sold firewood, charcoal and bricks the Msamvu neighborhood of Morogoro for 8 years. She belongs to Kariati group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40 US. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal, firewood and cement for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Fatuma is 46 years old, married, and has three children ages 16, 14 and 10. She also cares for four additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members Tausi, Husna and Hadija. Each woman also has her own small business in Morogoro.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, firewood, and cement for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. started selling fish five years ago in Sefwi in the western region of Ghana, where she lives. Ama prepares and serves very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. 

She is 26 years old and married with three children, including twins. One is currently schooling while the twins are breastfeeding. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fish to increase her sales and income, which will support her children’s education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa O. tiene la edad de 47 años, desde muy joven ayudaba a su mama a palmear tortillas pues era su fuente de subsistir, reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casada y con un hijo de 20 años de edad que estudia, su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad, su negocio es la venta de tortilla lleva once años ofreciendo sus ricas tortilla que es el alimento principal de los Nicaragüenses, con este crédito quiere compra materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo de su cocina que esta en mal estado. Sus planes es poder captar clientes nuevos y poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Felipa O., 47, helped her mother pat tortillas into shape. It was their source of survival. She lives in the 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has a 20 year old son who goes to school. Her husband works in a security service. Her business is selling tortillas. She has been offering her delicious tortillas, which is a primary food source to Nicaraguans, for 11 years. With this loan she wants to buy construction materials to improve her kitchen roof, which is in a bad state. Her plan is to be able to capture new customers and be able to get improved income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to repair the kitchen roof

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio P. reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de  Cuscatlán. Alexander tiene 31 años de edad,  vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos aun menores de edad. Alexander con cinco años de experiencia en su negocio se dedica a la elaboración de zapatos en variedad de diseños para niños y adultos, el deseo de Alexander y por lo cual solicita este crédito es porque quiere comprar materia prima por mayor ya que es la única manera con la cual obtendría una mejor ganancia y los mas importante siendo competitivo en el mercado, ya que los precios de Alexander van mas debajo de los otras zapaterías.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio P. lives in Cojutepeque in the Cuscatlán department. Alexander is 32, and he lives with his wife and their four minor children. Alexander has five years of experience in his business of making shoes. He makes a variety of designs for children and adults. Alexander’s dream, the reason he is asking for this loan, is to buy wholesale raw materials. That is the only way he can get better earnings. The most important thing is to be competitive in the market. Alexander’s prices are below those of the other shoe makers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale raw materials

loans.name: Folusho

texts.en:
Folusho is single lady, 26 years old; she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has sold stationery and books for over seven years.

Folusho has been with LAPO Micro-finance for the past three years and she is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more stationery to sell. She says thanks to LAPO Micro-finance and to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery to sell

loans.name: Toem

texts.en: T. is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She lives with her family in her own small family home in Kompong Tom Province. T. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as potatoes that she will collect and sell to buyers when the plants mature every three months. T.'s husband is a firewood seller. T.'s crop is not growing well because she lacks a supply of fertilizer. She is requesting a loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Rimy

texts.es:
El señor Rimy A. S. tiene 29 años y está casado con la señora Lidia Vera Lopez  por más de 10 años, ambos trabajan en la producción de leche cruda pero el señor Rimy también trabaja en su tiempo libre como mecánico en la mecánica de su tío. Aun no tiene hijos pues el señor Rimy asegura que primero quiere estabilizarse económicamente para que sus hijos no sufran por falta de dinero. 

El señor Rimy vive en la zona de Maica Central en Cochabamba, ellos recién hace dos años lograron reunir plata suficiente para construir una casa en el terreno que su padre le regalo como herencia y aunque la casa no es grande ni cuenta con todas las comodidades es suya y es su gran orgullo, en esta casa es donde tienen sus tres vacas con las cuales producen leche para luego venderla a una persona que elabora toda clase de productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le servirá puesto que a mayor número de vacas mayor es la cantidad de leche que producirán y así mejoraran sus ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito que saca con nuestra institución y mostro responsabilidad a la hora de realizar los pagos por eso fue considerado para otro préstamo. El señor Rimy desea en un futuro obtener un tercer crédito y poder mejorar su casita y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Rimy A. S. is 29 years old and has been married to Sra. Lida Vera Lopez for more than 10 years. Both are involved in raw milk production, but Sr. Rimy also works as in his spare time as a mechanic at his uncle’s repair shop. Although he does not have children, Sr. Rimy wants to make sure his family is financially stable so that they don’t suffer due to a lack of money.

Sr. Rimy lives in the area of Central Maica in Cochabamba. Two years ago, his family managed to raise enough money to build a house on the land that his father gave him as part of his inheritance. Although the house is not big, it has all the amenities he needs and gives him great pride. He currently owns three dairy cows that produce milk, which is later sold to a vendor who makes all types of dairy products.

This loan will be used to purchase an additional dairy cow. Not only will this increase his herd, but it will also increase milk production and improve his income.
