This is the second loan Sr. Rimy has received from our Institution and the responsibility he demonstrated previously enabled him to be considered for another loan. In the future, he hopes to receive a third loan so that he can improve his house and his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is 53 years old and is a resident of Barangay Calamagui in San Pablo, Isabela. She has 2 children, both of whom are already married. Charry Ann is 30 years old and a college graduate, and Paul is 28 years old but unfortunately was not able to finish college. Aida now has grandchildren, and she is very happy to take care of them. She also manages a hog raising business which serves as their primary source of income. 

Aida makes a living by raising pigs and selling them when they are fully grown. The pigs are raised in a small piggery next to her house. She also grows vegetables in her garden which provide her with food as well as another source of income. Due to financial difficulty, Aida wants to ask for a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 that will be used to buy all of the feed and supplies needed to raise her hogs for 4 months prior to selling them.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her hog raising business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes from Beijing, China

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor se dedica al transporte publico(Taxi) por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, el vehiculo es propio se dedica como chofer hace cuatro años, con vehiculo propio hace dos años, tambien ayuda a sus padres con una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, el señor es soltero. Es su segunda secuencia en la Institucion y a demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur works in the field of public transportation (taxi) throughout the city of Cochabamba. He owns his vehicle and has worked as a driver for four years, with his own vehicle for the past two years. He is single and helps his parents with a neighborhood store that they operate within their home. This is his second loan sequence with the institution, and he has shown himself to be highly responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tires, a new battery, accessories and other equipment

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells medicines at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo. She is friendly, hard working and determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 25 years old and married with a child. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell.  She hopes to own a maternity home in the future. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: This is Rosaline C., a young entrepreneur who lives in Pasay City, a bustling community in the middle of the metropolis. She is 34 years old and her husband, Arnel, 38, is a driver. One of their four children is in high school and two are in grade school. Rosaline has a stall near the Libertad Public Market selling mobile phones and other phone accessories. She also manages the operation of their fleet of three motorized tricycles. She earns more than P33,000 a month. Her profits answer for her family’s basic daily needs, especially her children’s education. Rosaline became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2002. She has applied for a new loan of P17,000 with the cooperative as additional capital for her business. She dreams of seeing all her children remain in school until they finish their studies. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: San Silvestre Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Silvestre II” esta representado por la señora Karen Yanely y conformada por 14 miembros de las cuales una gran mayoría se dedican a la venta de ropa, abarrotes, comida, cosméticos, verduras y al servicio de transporte público de pasajeros y a la chaparía de vehículos. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias tienen un alto nivel de competencia en el mercado ya que son las únicas que ofrecen sus productos, pero gracias  a su experiencia saben que cantidades se vende cada día para que puedan presupuestar sus insumos.  El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento de su capital de trabajo con el cual realizaran la compra de insumos para los días de ventas altas, cocinas con mayor potencia para realiza un trabajo mas eficiente, también apara la mejora de sus puestos de venta  para darles a sus clientes mayor comodidad; el resto de las socias realizará la compra de mercadería al por mayor.  Este banco va cursando ya un tercer ciclo demostrando muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con responsabilidad y esfuerzo, es por esta razón que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y fortaleciendo sus negocios ya que de ello depende el bien estar de sus familias y la oportunidad  de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "San Silvestre II" group is represented by Karen Yanely and is made up of fourteen members, most whom earn their living selling clothing, groceries, food, cosmetics, and vegetables, and providing public transportation and auto body repair services. As for the competitive environment, the members are highly competitive in their marketplace since they are the only ones offering their products and services; and thanks to their experience, they know how much business they need to do on a daily basis to budget for their supplies. The members plan to use their loan to increase capital. They'll buy supplies for the higher-volume days, more powerful stoves so they can work more efficiently, and they'll also improve their stands for their clients' convenience. The rest of the members will buy merchandise wholesale. The group is on its third loan cycle and the members are demonstrating a great desire to work and succeed through their responsibility and effort. That's why Fundación Agrocapital is providing them renewed financial support, so they can keep growing and strengthening their businesses. The well-being of their families and the opportunity to provide a better future to their children depend on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosario Beatriz

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Joaquín esta formado por un grupo de señoras que se encuentran dispuestas a entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos todos viven por el sector de San Joaquín, este es un sector muy hermoso de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la agricultura y también a la venta de cuyes asados, carnes asadas, canelazos (mezcla de canela, naranjilla y un poco de licor), etc.

La Sra. Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal San Joaquín, tiene una gran amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación les ha entregado hace 4 años y fue incentivada por una promotora de crédito para que forme parte de los beneficios que entrega la fundación y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado para surgir poco a poco creciendo en su negocio y en su familia, tiene un bar en una escuela hace 2 años y le va bien, siendo el horario que  labora de 7 a.m. hasta la 1 p.m. de lunes a viernes.

Rosario vive por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, por el sector de Cristo del Consuelo, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo trabaja como gerente de ventas en una empresa, con quien procreo 4 hijos que se encuentran de 29, 28, 22 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija es profesional y tiene un laboratorio clínico, su segundo y tercer hijo son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias y su ultimo hijo estudia en el colegio Unedid, siendo el orgullo y fruto de su esfuerzo el poder contar con su casa propia, con su nuevo préstamo que la fundación le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bar como son papas en fundas, gaseosas, bolos (jugo en fundas) helados, chupetes, etc., su meta es de seguir creciendo con su negocio y así poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Joaquin is comprised of a group of women who want to give their children a better future. They all live in the San Joaquin neighborhood, which is a very pretty part of the city of Cuenca. The majority of the population in this area works in agriculture and also in the sale of foods such as grilled meats and canelazos ( a hot drink made of sugar cane liquor, and cinnamon.) Rosario C. is a member of this communal bank. She enjoys a great friendship with all of her friends and colleagues in the communal bank. She has been taking loans from the foundation for 4 years. The loan representatives from the foundation inspired her to work with the foundation and take advantage of the benefits that it offers. She tells us that the loans have helped her to increase her business, little by little, allowing both her business and her family to see improvements. She has had a snack bar in a school for 2 years, and it is going well. She works from 7am until 1pm from Mondays through Fridays. Rosario lives by the city of Cuenca in the Cristo de Consuelo neighborhood. She is 51 years old, married, and her husband works as a sales manager for a company. They have 4 children aged 29, 28, 22 and 13 years of age. Her oldest daughter is a professional and has a laboratory clinic. Her second and third children are married and live independently with their families. Her youngest son studies at the Unedid school. She feels proud that through the fruits of her efforts she is able to have her own house. With the new loan from the foundation, she will buy products for her snack bar such as potato snacks, soft drinks, bolos (juice in a plastic sleeve), ice cream, lollipops, etc. Her goal is to continue to grow with her business and in this way give her best to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: potato snacks, bolos (frozen juice in packets), ice cream, lollipops, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo A. has been married for 24 years. She is a rice grower from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. The income, which she gets from growing rice, has helped her family a lot to buy food and other basic needs. Now, she has a little problem financing her rice farm. That is why she needed to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc to buy farm supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Melida Rosa

texts.es:
Melida Rosa R. H. es maestra de un colegio de primaria en el caco urbano del municipio de Condega. 

La Sra. Melida R. utilizara dicho crédito en la compra de medicamentos para ella y el pago de unos exámenes medico que se realizara ya que se encuentra un poco mal de salud, así como la compra de cerámica para componer la cocina de su casa ya que no tiene piso, ella quiere que su cocina sea mas higiénica y presentable.

Ella empezó a ser maestra desde hace unos 26 años cuando se graduó de maestra desde entonces ella realiza su trabajo 5 días a la semana de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 1 de la tarde y el resto de la tarde lo ocupa para planear las clase que impartirá el día siguiente.

Ella espera que al realizarse estos exámenes y comprar el medicamento reponerse de su estado de salud y seguir laborando como maestra ya que su seguro no le cubre para todos los exámenes, también con la compra de la cerámica espera que su cocina sea mas presentable y de esta manera seguir reconstruyendo su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida como la de su familia.

La Sra. Melida R. es casada  y tiene 2 hijas en edades escolares la que les toca costear sus gastos escolares con la ayuda de su esposo.

Este es el crédito numero 9 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 10 años, ella argumenta que con dichos financiamientos ella a logrado realizar varios proyectos como mejoras es su hora así como su salud ya que los ingresos mensuales que ella percibe no son los suficiente por lo que se muestra agradecida ya que el impacto de dichos créditos es positivo.
texts.en:
Melida Rosa R. H. is an elementary school teacher at a school located in greater Condega. Melida R. will use the funds to buy medicines for herself, top pay for some medical exams she will have done because her health isn’t the best, and to buy tile for her kitchen because it doesn’t have a floor; she wants her kitchen to be both more hygienic and more presentable. She’s been a teacher for 26 years, ever since she graduated as a teacher. She works five days a week, Monday through Friday, from 7am until 1pm. The rest of the afternoon she uses to plan the next day’s lessons. She hopes that the medicines she will buy and the medical exams she will undergo will restore her health so she can continue to work as a teacher because her insurance does not cover all the exams. She also hopes that the purchase of the tile will make her kitchen more presentable so that she can continue to remodel her home and improve her family’s living conditions. Melinda is married and has two, school-age daughters; their school-related expenses must be met by herself and her husband. This is her 9th loan with Ceprodel in the last 10 years. She insists that these loans have allowed her to complete several home improvement projects and have contributed to her health because her monthly salary is not sufficient for these expenses. She is grateful for the positive impact these loans have had.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines, pay for medical exams and to buy kitchen tile.

loans.name: Lea Marietta

texts.en:
Lea Marietta G. is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Lea Marietta is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lea Marietta owns and operates a business venture, food vending. Lea Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2010, Lea Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Lea Marietta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional meat and ingredients for her food vending. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lea Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Food Vending and Retailing

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old businessman who sells clothing and local brew in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is married with eight children and lives in a semi-permanent house of four rooms. His long term plan is to have a general merchandise wholesale shop.

Joseph has been in the clothing and local brew business for ten years and hopes to begin packaging the local brew and purifying it. The purpose of this loan is to buy more of the local brew to sell.

loans.use: To buy more local brew to sell

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma M. de 47 reside en Santa Tecla ubicado departamento de La Libertad, vive  junto a dos hijos mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan y junto a dos nietos. María posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad tales como: granos básicos, pan, leche, huevos y otros más. Su tienda es bastante grande y posee gran variedad de productos, lo que le permite contar con muchos clientes, los cuales se sienten muy satisfechos con el servicio brindado por María. Este negocio es un pilar fundamental en el sostenimiento de su hogar, por lo cual cuenta con el deseo de poder mejorarlo, ya que es gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por este que ella ha logrado salir adelante, María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar comida para perro, para gatos, mayor cantidad de granos básicos y bebidas, productos los cuales en la actualidad cuenta con mayor demanda. De esta manera ella espera mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Vilma M. is 47 years old and resides in Santa Tecla, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her two adult children, who are working, and her two grandchildren. María manages a store where she sells basic necessities such as grain, bread, milk, eggs, and other items. Her store is large enough for her to sell a wide variety of products. She has many customers who are very satisfied with the service she provides. This business is fundamental to sustaining her household. She has the desire to improve, and thanks to the income she has earned, she will be able to get ahead.

María is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy dog food, cat food, and large quantities of grains and beverages. These products are currently in great demand. She hopes to improve her sales as well as her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pet food, grain, and beverages

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Melina's Group

texts.en:
Melina S. is from the village of Gango, city of Ozamis. She is 51 years old. Melina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Melina is married and has 3 adult and two school-aged children. To make a living, Melina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melina has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Melina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Melina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Melina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: La Bendicion Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras,del paraje Pacorral, de la aldea Patachaj, del municipio de San Cristóbal Toto, del departamento de Totonicapán, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desde hace 6 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo integran de la siguiente manera: doña Santos Justiniana T. Chigüil, es la presidenta, ellas se dedican especialmente a la crianza de animales tales como; cerdos, ovejas, pollos y vacas,  y en  el caso de doña: Concepción A.  se dedica a la elaboración de jarros y ollas de barro y las otras personas se dedican al servicio como lo es a la confección de playeras y faldas venden sus animales en el centro de: Patachaj, San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán  y en algunos casos  las personas lo recogen en la casa de una de ellas, en el caso de doña: Concepción A. , vende en, Olintepeque y San Andrés Xecul , San Francisco el Alto, y San Cristóbal, Totonicapán,   necesitan ampliar sus producción de animales y también de la venta de Ropa , por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de pologuá, a solicitar un prestamo para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias,
texts.en:
This group of women is from Pacorral, of the village of Patachaj, town of San Cristóbal Toto, departament of Totonicapán. They are people who know each other very well. They have been working together for 6 years and the group is organized in this way: Santos Justiniana T. Chigüil is the president, and they mainly work raising animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens and cows. Concepción A. makes clay pitchers and pots and others makes t-shirts and skirts. They sell their animals in: Patachaj, San Francisco el Alto, and Totonicapán. In some cases, people pick them up in one of their homes. Concepción A. sells in Olintepeque and San Andrés Xecul , San Francisco el Alto, and San Cristóbal, Totonicapán. They need to expand their animal production and also clothing sales. Because of this, they went to the offices of ASDIR in Pologuá to ask for a loan for financing. They are doing this to improve their own living conditions and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mr. Moa R. is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sithorn Kiet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Mr. Moa R. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support his farming. Mrs. Sithorn Kiet is also a silk weaver who earns a small income to support her family. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. HERCILIA ANITA, TIENE 49 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, QUIENES SON EL MOTOR Y MOTIVO DE SU ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO PARA SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES FUERTES Y UNIDAS" FORMADO POR 9 PERSONAS MAS, QUIENES RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE SAN AGUSTIN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA. HERCILIA ANITA, SE DEDICA TODO EL DÍA A ATENDER SU LIBRERÍA BAZAR, HACE CINCO AÑOS PARA PODER CUIDAR A SUS HIJOS EN CASA, INSTALÓ UNA PEQUEÑA LIBRERÍA LA CUAL HA IDO CRECIENDO POCO A POCO, HASTA HABERLA CONVERTIDO AHORA EN UNA LIBRERÍA BAZAR.
CON SU NEGOCIO, ELLA PUEDE APOYAR A SUS HIJAS EN LOS GASTOS TANTO DE MATRICULA COMO DE MATERIALES PARA SUS ESTUDIOS Y ASÍ BRINDAR UN APORTE IMPORTANTE EN LA MANTENCIÓN DEL HOGAR Y LOGRAR MAS ADELANTE LA PROFESIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE ÚTILES Y ALGUNOS REGALOS PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Hercilia Anita is 49, married, and has four children. The children are the driving force and the motivation for her effort and sacrifice in order to get ahead. She is a member of the Mujeres Fuertes y Unidas group. It is comprised of nine other members. They live in the San Agustin area in the Comas district. Hercilia Anita works all day in her bookstore and bazaar. Five years ago she set up a small bookstore in order to be able to take care of her children at home. The store was growing little by little until she converted it into the bookstore and bazaar that it now is. With her business she is able to support her daughters with their expenses, which range from registration fees to school materials. That way she makes an important contribution in maintaining her household. She also enables her children to move ahead toward a profession. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and some gift items to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia M. N. is 45 years old, single, and has two boys whom she hopes to give a quality education. Her business is located in a growing estate in Nairobi called Dandora. She owns a restaurant in which she serves the local people. She says the business is profitable and the major challenges that she experiences include debtors not paying as per the agreement and the high prices of soft drinks. She has been in this business for the last two years and has managed to provide employment to two people. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more soft drinks to sell to the local people. She hopes to expand her business, install electricity in her premises and in the future, she hopes to diversify her business and establish a big supermarket. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for her restaurant.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Doña Octavia y Paulina V. O., son hermanas que viven en un solo hogar en su  comunidad Hualyallapujru en el municipio de Tiraque en el departamento de Cochabamba a 68 kilómetros sobre la carretera antigua a santa cruz.
 
La actividad principal de la señora Octavia y Paulina es la agricultura, este trabajo lo realizan solas, algunas veces con ayuda de los vecinos de su comunidad, mayormente trabajan solas tienen dos hijos que mantener en la familia. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para los insumos agrícolas para poder mejorar su producción de este año, de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder salir adelante y darles a sus hijos todo lo que puedan para que algún día sean lo mejor que puedan.
texts.en:
Octavia and Paulina V. O. are sisters who live together in Hualyallapujru in the municipality of Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba, 68 km along the old road to Santa Cruz. Octavia and Paulina's main source of income is agriculture, which they normally perform alone but sometimes with help from their neighbors. They have two children in the family to look after. The loan they are requesting is for agricultural supplies to help with this year's crop and so increase their income. Their dream is to be successful and give their daughters everything they can so they can be as successful as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Rony Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Rony Javier B. D. es cliente recurrente de nuestra empresa, el mismo es padre de una nena de 1 año y medio, y  se dedica a la compra-venta y distribución de balanceados en general, para animales de cría domestica y ganado vacuno, también distribuye coco rallado, lo realiza en su propio vehículo, el mismo está domiciliado en Cuidad del Este, donde se encuentra la empresa en la cual presta servicio, se trata de una persona solvente y con moralidad de pago.
El solicita para la compra de balanceados en gran cantidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Rony Javier B. D. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya and the father of a one and a half year old child. He buys, sells, and distributes livestock feed for domesticated animals and cattle. In addition, he sells grated coconut out of his own vehicle. He lives in Ciudad del Este, which also where the company he works for is located. Rony tries to be a person who manages his payments in a responsible and honest manner.

He is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of animal feed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of animal feed

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel V. R. tiene 42 anos. Es soltero y vive con su familia en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene un niño de 1 ano 3 meses. 

Miguel Angel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Miguel Angel se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de maíz. Realiza sus compras y ventas en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita el préstamo para avanzar en su agricultura. Su sueno es tener un futuro mejor que antes.  
Le gusta practicar deportes y pasear en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel V. R. is 42 years old, single, and lives with his family in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has a son who is a year and three months old. Miguel Angel is a member of the Communal Bank “Lucha Para Triunfar” (Fight To Win). There are 13 members in total, most of whom engage in agriculture.

Miguel Angel is a farmer who grows primarily corn. He buys and sells in the canton of Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be used to advance his farming activities. He dreams of having a better future than he had before.

In his free time, Miguel Angel enjoys practicing sports and going for walks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his farming activities

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem S., who was born in 1974, lives In Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vorn Sout, are farmers who own a 3.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. They own a plow machine and a harvest machine. Through those activities, this couple tries to work hard but they can earn very little money to support their family. 

To improve this condition, Mrs. Noem S. wants to start a new business and is seeking a loan to buy pig food and ten piglets for breeding. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is studying in school, while the others are helping with their parents’ businesses. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy pig food and ten piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: La señora vive con sus padres en alquiler en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, esta soltera y estudia en la universidad la carrera de Auditoría, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la confección de mantas  y las comercializa en los mercados con la ayuda de su mamá. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder estabilizar su negocio debido a que tiene varios clientes. Es parte de KIVA e IMPRO por primera vez.
texts.en:
She lives with her parents in a rented house in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. She is single and is studying Accounting at the university. During her free time she makes blankets that her mother helps her sell at market. The loan will be used to buy fabric so that she can stabilize the business since she has several customers. She is part of KIVA and IMPRO for the first time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Swastika

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Swastika T.. She is married and has two children aged seven and three. In 1985 she established her tea shop. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She wants to use loans from Patan BPW to increase inventory in her store. In the future, Swastika plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Michelle Joy

texts.en:
Michelle Joy A., from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon, is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Michelle Joy owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing and other personal products such as umbrellas in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Michelle Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie B. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years-old and married with a baby.  To make a living, Margie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste as well as biscuits, breads, and junk food in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Margie joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie G. is from the village of Barangay 23, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Melanie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used bags (or ukay-ukay bags) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2003, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Melanie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Julius Kamau

texts.en:
Julius is 57 years old and married to Hellen, with whom he has five children. Hellen helps with the farm, which adds to the family's income. Julius operates a public transport business, which has been running for one year.

He is taking his first loan with KADET. He has never borrowed from a microfinance institution before. He intends to use the loan to repair his vehicle to be able to carry passengers. 

He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and expand his transport business.

loans.use: To repair and and carry out maintainance work on his vehicle

loans.name: Betchelyn

texts.en:
Betchelyn A. is from the village of Esperanza West, Aurora, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Betchelyn is married and has four school age children. To make a living, Betchelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Betchelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Betchelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Betchelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will the third loan taken out by Betchelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She owns a small farming business growing tomatoes in greenhouses. Irina has been in this business for 7 years. During this time she has built six large greenhouses where she plants about 7,000 tomatoes.

Irina is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase additional film for some greenhouses. It will allow her to plant tomatoes earlier and keep them warm in the cold spring. The earlier Irina harvests the tomatoes, the higher the price. Irina hopes to increase her sales and invest the extra income back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional film for her greenhouses

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Don Juan Alberto habitante de la zona # 2 de la Escuela Mauricio Cajina 1/2 c. al oeste en Nueva Guinea, de 59 años de edad con 10 años de laborar para la casa de la Mujer como contador, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres y del cuido de su hijo menor, ya que son una familia bien humilde y bien trabajadora.  

Está solicitando su cuarto credito para invertirlo  compra de eléctrodomésticos y comprar pintura para pintar su vivienda , hay buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es caracterizado como una persona honesta trabajador y de buenas costumbres. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es gozar de mucha salud y trabajo para seguir ayudando a su familia.solicitamos al comité la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto lives in zone #2 a half of a block to the west of the Mauricio Cajina School in Nueva Guinea.  He is 59 years old.  He has worked for ten years as an accountant for the “Casa de la Mujer” (Women’s Clinic).  His wife does the household chores and takes care of their minor son.  They are a very humble and hard-working family.

He is requesting his fourth loan to buy electric appliances and to buy paint to paint his house.

He has good personal and business references.  He is known to be an honest and hard-working person with good habits.

His greatest dream in live is to enjoy good health and to work in order to keep helping his family.  

We are asking the committee to approve the requested loan.

loans.use: To paint his house

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem N., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

She weaves Cambodian silk, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend US $35 on food, $5 on the children’s education, and  $40 on other necessary expenses. N. is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products for sale

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 30 años, vive con su esposa Roxana y sus hijos Cristian de 12 años y Kevin de 3 años de edad, tiene casa propia en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, José trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda ganadera, además cultiva su propia tierra todos los años con Maíz y maicillo, este trabajo lo aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre.
José actualmente desea  construir una pequeña habitación y solicita un préstamo para comprar madera, cemento y hierro , para llevar a cobo la construcción, con esta inversión él y su familia tendrán su propia casita donde más amplia para que sus hijos estén cómodos.
Su propósito es que su condición de vida mejore y trabajar por conseguir este sueño es lo cada día le alimenta el espíritu trabajador.
texts.en:
Jose is an agriculturist. He is 30 years old and he lives with his wife, Roxana, and their children, Cristian, 12 years old, and Kevin, 3 years old. They have their own home in San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. Jose works as farm hand in a cattle farm. He also cultivates his own fields, growing corn and sorghum every year. He learned the business from his father when he was very young.  Jose wishes to build a small house and he requests a loan to purchase wood, cement, and steel rebars. With this investment, he and his family will have a larger home from where to live with their children in greater comfort. 

His goal is to improve their quality of life. Working to make his dream a reality is the driving force behind his motivation.

loans.use: To purchase wood, cement, and steel rebars.

loans.name: Honey

texts.en:
Honey A. is from the village of Sinian Baliangao Misamis Occ.. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, Honey owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Honey has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Honey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honey has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Honey is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Honey from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El Sr M.  labora como gestor colector  es  acompañado, tiene tres personas a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad de  este  desembolso, para compra de materiales como bloque, hierro cemento, madera, para pared de su vivienda asi darle segurida y proteccion a mi familia.
para poder tener una mejor vivienda digna, sin el apoyo de ustede no lo podia hacer, espero que me sigue a poyando para darle a mi familia nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Sr. M. works as a collections agent and lives with three people who are his dependents. This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL and he is grateful for the opportunity. He will use the funds to buy materials such as blocks, iron, cement, and wood to build a wall in his home which will provide security and protection for his family.

Without the assistance being provided, he would not be able to have a decent home. He hopes the support will continue so that his family can have a better life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Rocio Fernanda

texts.es:
Roció de 22 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene en la parte delantera de su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres. Vende arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su tienda de víveres. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende los víveres a un precio muy económico para sus clientes. Quiere seguir con su tienda por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. En el futuro quiere darle un buen futuro a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Roció is 22 years old. She is a young entrepreneur who has a small grocery store in the front part of her house. She sells rice, canned goods, beverages, grains, etc. 

She has great aspirations for her business, and she would like to continue operating her grocery store. She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day. She sells her products at prices that are very affordable for her customers. She would like to continue with her store, and for this reason she would like a loan to buy beverages, rice, sugar, etc. In the future, she would like to provide a good future for her four children.

loans.use: to buy beverages, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 31 years old and single. She runs a greengrocer shop to earn her living. She has been engaged in the business for three years. She hopes to get capital to open a restaurant some day.

Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to get business loans which she has used to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy fruit.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Batool's Group

texts.en:
Batool has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who sells vehicle tires. His shop is located in the market and he believes in selling good quality products; that’s why he has a good number of customers who prefers to buy tires from him. With the loan, he will buy new and used vehicle tires to sell in his shop. 

Batool sells bed-sheets to help her husband financially. She buys them from a wholesale market and sells to her local area clients.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are very young and are not of school-going age yet. She is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for her husband and he will be able to improve the financial condition of the family. 

Batool is a resident of Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. She has been living there in the area of Madhay Shah with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 15 years. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit behavior in the previous loan year and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires for tire-sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Abraham Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Abraham is a shoe shiner in the town of Naivasha.  He also owns a retail shop in the same town.  He is 41 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and has four children.  In the future, Abraham hopes to expand his retail shop to sell goods wholesale.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his second loan and he will use it to buy more goods to sell in his shop.  Abraham successfully repaid his previous loan of KES. 15,000.

loans.use: to buy cereal to resell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married and 55 years old. She raises pigs to sell in the future. Merlita had this business for 13 years.

Merlita is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy feeds and vitamins needed for the pigs. Each month, Merlita earns about PHP 7,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Merlita hopes that her business will improve so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. .Evelyn is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds for her pigs and piglets  She has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could expand her mini-grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 26 years old, married, and has five children. She has been selling vegetables for two years and makes around 6,000 KES a month. Teresa plans to use her loan to purchase more vegetables that she plans on reselling. 


She would like to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. This is Teresa’s first loan with KADET. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables that she plans on reselling.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami has worked as a barber for many years and opened his own barber shop in 2009. He is very talented and maybe that's why he has so many clients. Also, he doesn't charge much for his services.  He has a good client history. 

Now, he wants a loan of 1,500 ANZ, so he can buy newer instruments for hair cutting. This way, he thinks he can offer a better service for his clients. Nizami is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life.  Nizami promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase newer instruments for hair cutting and shaving.

loans.name: Brenda's Group

texts.en:
Brenda‘s group is comprised of two hard-working women. Brenda is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. Brenda has a small retail shop business that sells sugar. She has had this business for five years. She sells tap water as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Brenda hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Brenda hopes to own a plot of land. Brenda is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving in her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo Emilio y de su pequeño hijo, juntos habitan en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, y en la actualidad  siembra alverja junto a su pareja; aunque dice que la labor es algo sacrificada, pues debe madrugar todos los días para vigilar con dedicación sus cultivos. Pero le alienta saber que, la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo es la buena cosecha que obtiene cuando su producción de alverja esta lista para ser recogida. Es ahí que contrata la ayuda de operarios (trabajadores) que le ayudan a alistar  los pesados sacos para comercializarlos a los vendedores mayoristas de la ciudad. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus productos naturales son regulares, es por esta razón que puede ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como la labor agrícola le parece un negocio rentable, para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, además quiere comprar ganado porcino y empezar con la comercialización de estos animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Defina piensa sembrar alverja en sus terrenos agrícolas; por ello de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su proyecto agrícola.
texts.en:
Delfina is 30 years old and she lives in a house which is her own property. She lives together with her husband Emilio and their young son in the community of Cumutay. Since she was very young she has been involved in agriculture and currently she plants peas together with her partner. She says that the work is somewhat difficult especially because her days have to start very early in the morning to be able to diligently oversee the cultivation. But she gains strength in known that the reward for all of her effort is a good harvest, which is obtained when the products are ready to be collected. At that time she hires farmhands (workers) to help her get the heavy sacks ready for sale to the wholesalers in the city. The earnings which she will obtain from the sale of her natural products are steady and it is the reason why she is able to offer her family a good quality of life. She feels that agricultural work is a profitable business so in the future she plans on increasing her plantation to improve her earnings. She also wants to buy pigs to start a livestock business. 

She is a member of the communal bank "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay", meaning "A Beautiful Dawn in Cumutay" and it is her ninth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is committed to making her loan payments on time. She is also very thankful to those individuals who made this loan possible because it will help her to continue her work. Delfina plans on planting peas on her farmland and she needs your support for this to happen. She will invest the funds she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers to have a successful start her agricultural project.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Natividad works hard to support her family. 

Natividad requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Natividad has been in this business for 9 years.

Natividad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes, la socia vende pelotas, muñecas, rompecabezas entre otros juguetes, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes al por mayor como muñecas, pelotas y carros.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”. It is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

The member's name is Mrs Roxana. She is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She has 3 children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling toys. She sells balls, dolls, puzzles and other toys. She has a stall at the Urubamba market which is open from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. Mrs Roxana wants to expand her toy-selling business. She is asking for the loan in order to buy toys in bulk such as dolls, balls and trucks.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and agrees to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy toys such as dolls, balls and trucks in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos  ella vive sola,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja .

Maria  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes . El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha . Enfreta desafios como la falta de dinero para invertir. Su sueño es tener mas terrenos para seguir cultivando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta visitar a los padres.
texts.en:
Maria Elisa is 48 years old, single, and has no children. She lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

The Communal Bank called “El Placer” is part of the canton of Chillanes and in the parish of San Jose del Tambo, which is located 30 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. This Communal Bank consists of 24 members who are farmers. They grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soybeans, and oranges. In addition, they raise domesticated animals.

Maria grows rice, corn, oranges, soybeans, and bananas. She purchases her supplies in San Jose del Tambo and sells her products at the market in Chillanes and at the fair on Sundays.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy farming supplies and fertilizers. This money will help him improve her crops. Her main challenge is not having enough money to invest. Her dream is to acquire more land so that she can continue cultivating.

During her free time, Maria enjoys visiting her parents.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yosein Sander

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Yosein, el socio tiene 18 años de edad, el socio es soltero, el socio trabaja desde hace 3 años trabajando como chofer, el socio es invitado de este grupo desde hace 3 años al igual que sus otros compañeros, el socio tiene su combi y trabaja en la ruta de Cusco, el socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de autopartes, revisión técnica de sus unidad vehicular, el socio está ahorrando su dinero para empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional, el socio tiene deseos de superarse y estudiar y ser profesional, tener su flota de autos y para eso él sabe que desea trabajar mucho. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de autopartes para su combi como luces y la revisión técnica de sus combi.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Sr. Yosein is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 18 years old, single, and has worked as a driver for three years. Yosein and some other gentlemen were invited to join this group three years ago. He has a minibus and drives along a route in Cusco. Yosein wants to invest this loan in the purchase of auto parts and technical repairs to his vehicle. He is saving up money so that he can begin studying for a professional degree. Yosein has the desire to succeed, to study, and to become a professional. He aspires to own a fleet of automobiles, but he knows that reaching his goal requires a lot of work. Yosein is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of parts for his minibus, such as headlights, as well as repairs.

He is grateful for the support that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his minibus and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Halim

texts.ru: Халим женат имеет двоих детей. Он занимается услугами такси. Выручка помогает содержать семью. Он единственный кормилец в семье. Более 2 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и набрал достаточно опыта.  Он хочет получить хороший прибыль от данного бизнеса. Он хотел бы получить займ для погашения остаточной суммы приобретенного автомобиля для продолжения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарить вас всех за вашу понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Halim is married and has two children.  He provides taxi services.  His earning help to support his family.  He is the sole provider for his family.  He has been in this business for over 2 years and has sufficient experience.  He would like to earn good revenues from this business.  He would like to take out a loan to pay off the remaining balance on his car in order to continue his business.  He thanks all of you in advance for your understanding and support.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining balance on his car

loans.name: Sinoeun

texts.en:
Sinoeun is 38 years old with 4 children. She is a local buyer of mango fruits which she sells at the market. She is also a farmer. She has been in her business for 8 years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy mango fruits for resale and to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her mango stock and increase her crop yields to earn more income to buy some necessary household stuff, to have some savings for her family, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy mango fruits for resale and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible and kind person. He is 53 years old and married. The couple is glad because they are blessed with three healthy children. Eduardo's wife is businesswoman who manages their fruit farm. One of his goals is to improve his rice fields and fruit farm, which will enable the family to increase their profits. 

Eduardo said that being a farmer is not that easy because you need to prepare a lot of things and see to it that it is productive. He is grateful because his wife supports him in cultivating their rice fields. Eduardo has managed his farm for almost 30 years. 

He would like to ask for additional capital in the amount of 30,000 Philippines pesos to purchase farm supplies and to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing crops in his rice fields. This would really help him because the income generated from the farming business goes immediately to his obligations to traders, allowances, daily household expenses, payment for electric bills and toward the school fees of his children. Eduardo is hoping that he could obtain the loan amount he requested so that he could continually support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing crops in his rice fields.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 26 años, empezó alquilando una tricimoto pero con lo que todos los días trabajaba decidió reunir  dinero y poco a poco pudo comprar su propia tricimoto.

En la actualidad realiza su trabajo solo todos los días si horas fijas de trabajo. Hasta ahora no ha tenido ningún problema en su trabajo. Si está casado su esposa trabaja en un restaurante así ayuda a los gastos de la casa no tiene hijos.

Tiene muchas aspiracion con su trabajo y el resturante de su esposa por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar sillas, mesas para el restaurante de su esposa y algunas herramientas para la tricimoto. 

Su meta es poder construir su casa propia o poder poner un bazar para que su esposa trabaje sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old.  He started out hiring a motorcycle taxi but, as he was working every day, he decided to put together some money and was gradually able to buy his own motorcycle taxi.

Carlos currently works alone every day.  He does not work regular hours.  Up to now he hasn't experienced any problems in his work.  He is married and his wife works in a restaurant to help with their household expenses.  They do not have any children.

Carlos has many aspirations for his work and his wife's restaurant.  For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs for his wife's restaurant and some tools for his motorcycle taxi.

Carlos' goal is to build his own home and to set up a store so that his wife can work without problems.

loans.use: to buy tools, tables and chairs

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс активный и целеустремленный юноша. Три года назад он открыл свой бизнес и стал успешен. Он продает мужскую обувь на местном рынке. Он имеет постоянных клиентов и хочет привлечь еще новых клиентов. Для этого он хочет добавить новый ассортимент обуви для разнообразия товара. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 800$ США. Он надеется на вашу помощь, и благодарит вас за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Firdavs is an active and goal-oriented young man.  He opened his own business three years ago and became successful.  He sells men's shoes at the local market.  Firdavs has loyal customers and wants to attract even more new customers.  For this, he wants to add a new assortment of shoes to vary his merchandise.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of $800.  Firdavs hopes to get your help and thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of shoes

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is a 35-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for five years.
Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar, and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, and onions to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a single parent with 7 dependents. She sells fish and yams in Asebu Brebia, which she has done for 15 years. Ekua uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase fish and yams to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to establish a business.

loans.use: purchase yams and fish to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. He aims to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs. Hussein decided to work on his own and has opened his own carpentry shop. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. He works independently and looks forward to taking on new projects. Today, he needs to take out a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase an electrical saw for his work. He also wants to buy new tools and materials. He notes that this will improve his business; thus, boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects and better develop his work.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical saw for his work

loans.name: Menn's Group

texts.en:
Menn is aged 28 years old and married with four children. To make a living, she has been working as a farmer and has been growing cassava and cashew for several years. The current business earns her family about 53,000 KHR per day to feed their children. 

Menn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now, she is going to use her portion to buy a tractor for supporting her agribusiness. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for supporting her agribusiness.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. Her business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved and better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Orhan

texts.en: Orhan S. is 44 years old with high school education in economics, ancestral fish retailer. Everybody in Silistra town remembers his father – Assen S. as a good and honest retailer. His son Orhan inherited his business and the things went well – he succeeded to buy a specialized fish storehouse. In 2002 he had a car accident and his business temporarily stood still. After he recovered he started his business with fish again. For this purpose he opened a small shop at the cooperative market. His wife works in the shop as well. With the income from the shop the family earns its own living and sees two children through the Higher Institute in Economics in Varna.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigeratory glass-case

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada She is married with a child. She lives in Dar es Salaam City, Tanzania. She is a qualified nurse at Muhimbili College of Health Sciences. She has a pharmacy for the care of people in her community. Her business is licensed by the authorities.

She wants to add a stock of drugs especially for malaria and amoebic dysentery. These diseases are very common to people of her area. She needs a loan of USD550. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Catalina del Carmen, and my principal activity is selling firewood and tortillas. I have several years of experience dedicating myself to this type of activity, which generates income to cover my expenses, since all my children are already married and I am on my own. At present I need to invest more in firewood since winter is coming and there is a shortage of this product, so I am asking for support from you.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Mi nombre es Catalina del Carmen, mi actividad principal es la venta de leña y torillas, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para mis gastos ya que todos mis hijos se casaron y quede sola, actualmente necesito inveritir mas en leña ya que se aproxima el invierno y este producto se vuelve escaso, razon por la cual solicito el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: To buy oak firewood and corn

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Ilhom A. is 32 years old, married and has three children. He has a college education and his profession is teaching English. Because he is a teacher, it is impossible for him to build a good future for himself and his young family on his salary alone, so he has also started a business selling men’s shoes. When their children are in school, his wife helps out in their shop.

When Ilhom and his wife started borrowing from MLF MicroInvest in 2002, the value of their assets was $450. After receiving credit and making effective use of it, the value of their assets rose to $1,700. Now Ilhom has come to us for a new loan of $900 to increase his product offerings and improve his place of business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Ашрафов Илхом – 32года. Женат, имеет 3х детей. Образование высшее, по специальности педагог английского языка. Дети учатся в школе, жена помогает мужу в его торговле. Так как одной зарплатой невозможно построить хорошее будущее, будучи педагогом, он начал заниматься реализацией мужской обуви. Когда начал кредитоваться в «Микроинвест» в 2002году, его активы составляли 450$. После получения кредита и целевого использования его активы возросли до 1700$. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить ассортимент и улучшить место своей деятельности.

loans.use: Increase product assortment and improve place of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Boost his Stock

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara has a small produce stand on a very rutted dirt road in Zana. But the road is well trafficked with pedestrians, so her location is good. She has operated this stand for 4 years. Today she is selling tomatoes, cabbage, passion fruit, banana leaves and sugar cane. The banana leaves are used to cover mashed bananas which are then steamed or boiled to make the dish called matooke. Bananas are the largest part of villagers' diet.

She plans to use her loan to buy more produce for her stand. Produce stands are quite common. There is little variation in the products they sell, though the products change regularly, depending on what is ripening. Barbara is married, age 32 and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her roadside stand

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor has a small medal working/blacksmith shop where he does metal work and creates a variety of quality metal products. Igor’s business is located at his home in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of western Ukraine. He has been in his quite successful business for about six years and now employs two other people. Igor has developed a reputation for fast service, making quality products for reasonable prices. He makes about $1400 profit in a normal month and has about $8000 invested in his business. Igor is married and has two kids - a daughter who is 20 and a son who is 11.

Igor has requested an eight month loan of $1200 to purchase material to use in his business. He has proven to be an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, paying off all previous loans in full and some even early. We are happy for the opportunity to continue helping this dedicated, hard-working entrepreneur operate a successful business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for medal working trade

loans.name: Emmaus

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Emmaus K.. She is married with three children. In 2005 Emmaus established a grocery business and, in 2006, a hair salon. Emmaus has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a loan of $525 in order to purchase an additional stock of hair care products and wigs in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support; hence. poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair care products and wigs in bulk.

loans.name: Mei

texts.en: Mrs. Mei S., 73, is married with 9 children and works making fried bananas and selling them to the people in her area, marking on average about $3 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Heam Horn, 74, is warehouse security guard, and he typically earns around $6 a day. Seven children live away from home and two others works as garment workers, making on average $2 each a day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for his son to use as a motor-taxi driver, and the rest of money they will use to renovate their house. (The picture shown is the oldest son of Mrs. Mei S.)

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for his son to use as a motor-taxi driver, and the rest of money they will use to renovate their house.

loans.name: Ngem

texts.en:
